programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Five Bells near Dover, where manager Shelley Parnell and her competitive mum Linda Yates hope their bargain-priced B&B will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts check in to the Thomas Paine Hotel in Thetford, where an inappropriate book is found in a bedside drawer and competition turns fierce at a Home Guard training exercise.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sarah Whitehead invite their fellow hoteliers to Tenbury Wells in Worcestershire, where they open the doors of their historic pub The Rose and Crown.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lesley and Steve Hawker welcome the contestants to the Woodlands Guest House in Exmoor, but after the bad feedback of previous rounds, it seems their rivals are out for revenge.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up to find out what they have been paid. Shelley and Linda from The Five Bells want to know why their feedback for breakfast doesn't add up, while Gez from the Thomas Paine Hotel wants to find out why Shelley and Linda scored him so low. Chris and Sarah from The Rose and Crown want to question Gez, and Steve and Lesley from Woodlands Guest House try to get to the naked truth.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first of a week of dinner parties in Belfast is hosted by 30-year-old mobile phone sales manager Steve, who hopes to impress guests Justin, Julie, Cushla and Marty.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: As the competition continues in Belfast, hairbrush executive Julie hopes to charm her way to the prize with an evening of fusion food inspired by her time in Japan and Hong Kong.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Belfast, mobile barista Justin hosts the latest dinner party, hoping his barbecue extravaganza will wow the guests, with even the dessert to be toasted on the coals.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Belfast sees executive assistant Cushla trying to win over her guests with some impressive cuisine, while Steve continues to dominate with his dodgy impressions.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Garage owner Marty hosts the final dinner party of the week in Belfast, but after a week of endless Bo' Selecta! impressions, Steve is beginning to get on everyone's nerves.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Paul Quentel, president of Alfred Angelo, the second largest bridal retailer in the United States, goes undercover to solve any problems as quickly as possible. Posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition, he works among his own staff.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. The chef questions whether owner Richard Davis's interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richard's sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishment's financial troubles.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Old Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick pushes the boundaries of veterinary medicine, and treats a German shepherd puppy that needs surgery on his hips and front leg using groundbreaking cell treatment. The vet must also perform delicate surgery on a Chihuahua suffering from a neck deformity compressing its spinal cord - however, one false move could be fatal. Plus, a rescue dog with deformed front legs is brought into the surgery.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan taking on guest captain Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan, and Bill Bailey in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Self-proclaimed family man James looks forward to the arrival of his fifth child and Kirsty, who was the first triplet to be delivered at Liverpool Women's Hospital returns to have her own baby, hoping motherhood is the key to a more independent life. Meanwhile, an unexpected pregnancy for Jo, still living with her parents at the age of 35, means a busy retirement for first-time grandparents Jean and John.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Icebergs explode into thousands of pieces in Antarctica, locals film a rare snowstorm in the Saudi Arabian desert, and more than 10,000 seabirds are killed off the north-west coast of America when storms churn up algae in the waters, creating deadly sea foam. In Canada, tourists witness a full-circle rainbow, and a firefighter in Texas is caught up in a wave of hail so large that it shuts down the highway.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The Hi Way elephant family have been hit with a potentially deadly virus affecting animals in captivity and in the wild. With the youngest members of the family most at risk, the keepers and Chester Zoo's veterinary team do all they can to combat the mysterious illness. Meanwhile, Mac the stallion zebra is introduced to the zoo's three mares in the hope they will produce much needed offspring for this endangered species. There's also a look into the bizarre world of the naked mole rat.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Nahida from Liverpool is searching for a man who shares her passion for food, and her date is with fellow Liverpudlian Thomas, who describes himself as a loveable bear. Ex-cruise ship worker Dale, 46, has been single for five years since his partner passed away, but is now ready to put his faith in Cupid again, and his date is 39-year-old massage therapist Chris.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdicombe reflect on the highs and lows from the World Para Athletics Championships, currently taking place in London. The trio are joined by comedian Johnny Vegas, Paralympic double gold medallist Liam Malone and many other current and former participants.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mike Bloom, president and COO of discount retail chain Family Dollar, intends to double its number of stores within a few years. He decides that to do so he first needs to go incognito within the organisation to monitor where the firm is excelling and where it needs improvement.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Travis Boersma, co-founder and president of one of the largest privately owned drive-through coffee shop chains in America, goes undercover to learn whether the culture he and his brother hoped to implement is being upheld by the company's front-line employees.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps a retired couple searching for a house in south Wales, as well as two keen sailors who want a property in Hampshire with easy access to the sea and London.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps newlyweds Iris and Alan Ford from Kent, who with a budget of £300,000 are hoping to split their retirement between the UK and the island of Tobago in the Caribbean.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Sue and Dave Atkins from Norwich have spent their time travelling since finishing work, and have now decided the Tampa Bay area in Florida is the best place to escape the cold British weather. With a budget of just over £100,000, Sara Damergi shows them five ideal properties.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.sub-title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun: Davenport, Florida.
programme.desc: Angela and Michael Sidebotham from Lincolnshire are ready to fulfil their life-long dreams of buying a home in Davenport, Florida, where they plan to spend half of each year. With a budget of £160,000, Sara Damergi shows the couple five properties that meet their requirements.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Kerry Herbert from Brighton has dreamed of buying a property on Grenada since she visited the Caribbean island as a child. With her teenage son about to fly the nest and after dealing with the loss of her father, she has decided to take the plunge and buy somewhere that she, her son and her partner can enjoy. Jonnie Irwin helps shows her five properties - but it remains to be seen whether any of them will tempt Kerry to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi searches the Kissimmee area of Florida to find a holiday home suitable for mother and daughter Jane and Bethan Thomas, who wish to buy a place close by the sunshine state's theme parks that they adore so much. Within their £70,000 budget, the options include a two-bedroom apartment and a three-bedroom lakeside house that offers a promising rental return.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: A few years ago Kieran Alexander was involved in a serious motorbike accident that has given her, and partner Dave Dwyer, a new outlook on life - that it is for living and there is no time like the present. They've decided to leave their stressful lives in the UK behind and start again in the Azores in the Atlantic. With a budget of £100,000 to fund their new home, Ben Hillman shows them five properties on the main island of Sao Miguel.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton shows retired couple Angela and Bernie Ward five properties in Cyprus, hoping that on a budget of £185,000, one of them will prove to be their dream home.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples looking for somewhere to live in Buckinghamshire, where they can combine high-flying careers in the capital with peaceful small-town life for their young families. Shane and Annamarie Mugan have a budget of £850,000, but have not found their ideal home after viewing more than 50 properties, while Emma and Andrew Jarvis face tough competition as they search for a four-bedroom house with plenty of character.(n)

programme.desc: An unhappy orphan living with his cruel aunts discovers a gigantic peach growing in the garden. programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother. Featuring games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat, as well as reactions to the latest eviction. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents chase almost £3,000 owed by Indian takeaway owners, but when the staff deny any knowledge of the debt, the agents threaten to seize kitchen equipment. In east London they face a race against time to recover more than £8,000 from an electrical services company, and in Cheshire the enforcement agents chase nearly £4,000 of debt owed by a mobile phone shop.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Experienced enforcement agent Stewart and trainee Iain head to Blackpool to chase down a builder owing nearly £3,500 to an unhappy customer, whilst father and son Del and Dael are in Essex to collect over £2,500 owed to a frozen food company. In south London, Del and Brian attempt to recover nearly £10,000 from a debtor who acted as guarantor for a friend's rental agreement, ending in a bizarre stand-off with the debtor's daughter.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Ben try to drill through the locks on a property to evict the residents, only to find to their surprise that the door has been modified with some special reinforced metal. Elsewhere, Delroy and Brian try to reclaim money a garage owes to a customer and are shocked by the condition of the vehicle in question, and a woman who has acted as guarantor for her sister's tenancy does not realise the extent of her responsibilities.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court Enforcement agents evict a large group of squatters barricaded into a disused nursery in London, and have to resort to smashing their way in as they refuse to leave. Meanwhile, agents in Bristol try to recover over £10,000 owed by a plumbing business to a supplier, and emotions run high when they attempt to evict a tenant who pleads her innocence in West London.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady plays cupid for 50-year-old Bournemouth Post Office manager Gary, who claims his loud shirts help him stand out from the crowd. Also seeking love is student Amy from Leeds, who works in a pub, and is nicknamed `Dolly Daydream' by the punters due to her mind's tendency to wander. Both are given a chance to quiz their three potential sweethearts, before choosing one to spend more time with. Plus, Paul catches up with last week's couples.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The ongoing documentary series profiling some of Britain's welfare recipients continues, this time highlighting people who are keen to find love, all while struggling to make ends meet. In Norwich, 56-year-old Donna built an alter-ego as a means to escape a life of hand-outs, and is now tentatively trying her hand at online dating. Doncaster resident and sci-fi fan Carl, 39, tries to save some of the £140-a-month he receives in benefits to attend a comic convention, where he hopes to discover a mutual attraction with a like-minded girl. Meanwhile, in Bury St Edmunds, 25-year-old single mother Jade worries her OCD-driven cleaning routine is getting in the way of her quest to find the perfect - and gainfully employed - man.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Documentary series about people living on benefits, including 60-year-old Avril, who is one of the long-term unemployed. Her nickname is the Bargain Queen because she spends so much time at car-boot sales - although her biggest bargain so far is a free holiday, courtesy of her mother. Steve has just returned to the UK from Turkey and at 56 is facing unemployment for the first time in his life, and transgender Jess finds jobseeking difficult while she undergoes her transitional medical treatment.(n)

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: A slave named Django is tracked down by eccentric German bounty hunter Dr King Schultz, who offers him his freedom in exchange for help bringing three criminals to justice. The unlikely allies continue their partnership after the job is done, and fight to rescue Django's wife from a sadistic plantation owner. Quentin Tarantino's Oscar-winning Western, starring Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: George Clooney is superb in this intelligent and complex character study of a burned-out "fixer" at a powerful corporate law firm in New York City who faces a crisis of conscience as he comes to grips with his amoral actions. Written and directed by Tony Gilroy(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: In this exhilarating drama based on true events, legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: Jim Sheridan ("My Left Foot") co-wrote and directed this heartwarming drama about a scrappy Irish clan adjusting to life in a New York City tenement in the 1980s while trying to put a family tragedy behind them. Samantha Morton, Paddy Considine, Djimon Hounsou, Sarah Bolger, Emma Bolger, Juan Hernandez, Jason Salkey, Rene Millan(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: Thriller about a gynaecologist's wife who goes looking for vengeance when her husband commits suicide amid accusations of molestation from some of his patients, causing her to lose her unborn baby. The young widow tracks down the woman who made the first complaint and insinuates herself into the family under the guise of a nanny in order to take her brutal revenge and steal the family she never had(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Two pals grow up with the same vocation; one becomes a rabbi, the other a Catholic priest. But their faith and friendship are tested when old schoolfriend Anna Reilly shows up in town. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Comic jewels Tina Fey and Amy Poehler, who once shared the "Saturday Night Live" stage, reunite in this outrageous romp. Fey's a buttoned-down career woman who agrees to let loopy working-class girl Poehler become the surrogate mother of her child. Steve Martin costars as Fey's New Age health-food entrepreneur boss, and Sigourney Weaver is hilarious as a smug director of the surrogacy agency. Written and directed by Michael McCullers, former writer at "SNL."(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: New York, 1975. Carlito Brigante, a Puerto Rican drug dealer, is released from jail after serving five years. He vows to go straight and to live life as a fine, upstanding citizen. He even rekindles a romance with his ex-lover. However, Carlito's old associates cannot seem to leave him in peace. His nephew involves him a pool-room gunfight, his lawyer asks him for 'favours' which spiral out of control, and even an old friend tries to get him into trouble with the law. Carlito decides to make a run for Florida and the promise of a new life, but has one final dramatic escape to make from a gang of criminals who believe that he was behind the murder of their boss(n)

programme.title: All the President's Men
programme.desc: Robert Redford and Dustin Hoffman are the crusading Washington journalists who uncover a link between Watergate and Nixon's White House. Seminal political thriller(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: An epic version of the legendary western sheriff-gunslinger, Wyatt Earp's life story, who lived from 1848 to 1929. Growing up on a farm in Iowa, Earp tries to run away to join the Union Army in the Civil War, but he is turned away because of his youth. Instead, he studies law and marries Urilla Sutherland. But Urilla dies of typhoid fever before they can have children, and Earp grows despondent and loses his way(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: The eldest son of a 1950s-era Midwestern family sets out on an existential journey that leads him to question his faith while seeking the answers to life's most challenging mysteries in this evocative drama from celebrated director Terrence Malick.Meanwhile, as Jack's innocence slowly erodes, his turbulent relationship with his father becomes the specter that hangs over his every thought and action. Giovanni Ribisi plays Elliott, the enigmatic engineer who persuades the survivors they can scavenge enough from the crashed plane to build another to fly them to safety while, unlike in the original, a love interest is provided by Miranda Otto as the tough yet vulnerable Kelly. Superbly photographed by Brendan Galvin, this stands against the original, with the mix of characters providing the drama and the take-off of the cobbled-together aircraft a nail-biting climax(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: Ron Howard helms this adaptation of Nathaniel Philbrick's historical novel about the harrowing high-seas encounter that inspired Herman Melville's Moby Dick. In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days. Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy, Ben Whishaw, and Brendan Gleeson co-star(n)

programme.title: Wish I Was Here
programme.desc: A 35-year-old father who's never quite grown up learns about life when he's forced to home-school his kids, since their grandpa can no longer afford their private-school tuition and their public school is a mess(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage is the slick financier who usually wakes up to a blonde and the Wall St Journal. But not today, because angel Don Cheadle gives him a glimpse of what might have been, with kids, a wife and a job selling tires(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: The movie details the experiences of Peter Pan author J.M. Barrie, which lead him to write the children's classic. He got to know four children who have no father. Drawing from his time with the kids, he writes a story about children who don't want to grow up(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Sports biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards (Taron Egerton), whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics at Calgary marked the first time a Brit had ever competed in the ski-jumping event. Edwards trains as a ski jumper under the tutelage of a hard-drinking former champ (Hugh Jackman), and eventually finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best. Directed by Dexter Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: A cocky marketing student works in a bar to get by, but falls under the tutelage of an older barman, who encourages him to live a selfish, hedonistic lifestyle(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: Hollywood filmmaker Donald Petrie directs the comedy Welcome to Mooseport. Gene Hackman stars as former U.S. President Monroe "The Eagle" Cole. He's retired to the small New England town of Mooseport, ME, in order to write his memoirs and relax. The retirement is put on hold, however, when he's persuaded to run for mayor of the town. Meanwhile, local hardware store owner and plumber Handy Harrison (Ray Romano) is just the sort of plaid-shirted everyman to run against him. Cole seems a sure win in the race, especially with his loyal personal assistants (Marcia Gay Harden and Fred Savage) aiding his every move. The competition gets even more severe when Handy's sweetheart Sally (Maura Tierney) comes between the two men. Welcome to Mooseport also stars Christine Baranski and Rip Torn(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: David Wain's comedy stars Paul Rudd and Seann William Scott as a pair of irresponsible salesmen who find themselves acting as very unlikely role models for two wayward kids. Danny and Wheeler make their living promoting a high-energy drink to pupils as a wholesome alternative to drugs. The job fits perfectly with uber-slacker Wheeler's rock'n'roll lifestyle, while cynical Danny, whose focus is his girlfriend Beth, feels underused and that his life is dribbling away. However, neither men can find the motivation to grab life by the scruff - until, one day, they deliberately crash their truck and are given the choice between jail or community service. They choose the latter, becoming mentors to a 10-year-old breast-obsessed lad called Ronnie and teenage role-play gamer Augie. It's difficult to tell whose behaviour is worse, the children or the 'adults', but a battle of wills ensues, which will have a meaningful outcome for each of the quartet..(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: This satirical comedy starring Sandra Bullock as a political consultant gives viewers an inside look at the high-stakes, win-at-all-costs world of politics. Bullock stars as "Calamity" Jane Bodine, who is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival Pat Candy (Billy Bob Thornton), who is working on the opponent's campaign and is also looking for every opportunity to antagonize Jane. The film is loosely based on the 2005 documentary of the same name by Rachel Boynton. Directed by David Gordon Green (Pineapple Express, George Washington). Produced by Oscar-winners George Clooney and Grant Heslov(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of professional climbers successfully scale Mount Everest only to be faced with tragedy when a monster storm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent. Jake Gyllenhaal, Josh Brolin, Jason Clarke, and John Hawkes co-star. Directed by Baltasar Kormakur (2 Guns)(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: In November 1974, a family of six was brutally murdered. Now, a year later, an unsuspecting young couple, George and Kathy Lutz, and their children move into the house that was the site of the horrific event and is now haunted by a murderous presence. What follows is 28 days of unimaginable terror. With demonic visions of the dead and relentless screams of terror, this is the haunted house story that isn't just a movie - it's real(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: Planet Earth stands on the brink of destruction as alien visitor Klaatu arrives to deliver a grave warning(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: In 1985, bar mitzvah and wedding singer Robbie Hart sings his rendition of popular '80s tunes along with humorous party patter. Julia is a waitress at these events, and she is engaged to womanizing Glen. After Robbie gets stood up at his own wedding, he and Glen begin courting(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla serves up a stern slice of justice for a contractor who took a couple's savings to build a balcony and a backyard oasis, but left the project not fit for purpose.(n)

programme.title: Her Evil Twin
programme.desc: A married couple are struggling with their crumbling relationship when the wife receives a letter informing her that she has a previously unknown long-lost twin sister. The husband then begins a torrid affair with his newfound sister-in-law, but soon finds she is treacherous and dangerous. Thriller, starring Sonya Walger and Ben Bass.(n)

programme.title: Amish Abduction
programme.desc: A young Amish woman visits her cousin in Charm, Ohio for the summer, where she discovers another world and finds friendship. But she soon has to choose which life she wants. Drama, starring Trevor Donovan and Daniella Chuchran.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Uneasy Lies the Crown
programme.desc: A dentist with gambling debts discovers his wife is having an affair with one of his patients and wants a divorce. He plans to take revenge by poisoning the lover with his wife's heart medication, so she will be suspected - but he reckons without the attentions of the crumpled cop. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, James Read, Paul Burke, Jo Anderson and Nancy Walker.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is forced to tackle a case with a personal element when his father is discovered drunk in a car that has a dead body in the boot. The victim is revealed to be Navy lieutenant Dean Massey, who DiNozzo Sr had threatened to kill after being cut out of a land development deal. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. After being stationed in Kabul, she became pregnant by a local man called Amir who was later killed in action - and Abby discovers he was the sole male heir of a wealthy family that owns a large tract of land in a politically sensitive part of Afghanistan.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander last seen in the company of a mysterious blonde woman, who turns out to be missing NCIS agent and Tony's ex-lover EJ Barrett. She identifies the murderer as Seal-turned-assassin Marcellus Dane, who is suspected of working for Casey Stratton - a member of black ops unit Phantom Eight. Guest starring Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The agents try to track down the Navy employee responsible for uploading sensitive documents onto an internet blog. Discovering the owner of the website has been tortured and killed, they realise the culprits were trying to obtain the decryption key to access the classified material.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A blogger who devoted his energies to exposing corruption within government is found dead and it transpires he had recently suggested that some Navy Seals had overstepped the mark in their use of force. As the team gets to grips with the case hoping the claims are wrong, another body turns up with its tongue removed, and near the body a hair is found that guides investigators to a suspect - a Navy Seal. However, the possibility that the team is being deliberately led astray remains. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The Navy's finest female pilot dies at an air show while demonstrating a state-of-the-art aircraft about to be brought into service. Fearing the press will have a field day over the capability of women pilots, a senior Navy officer calls for the team's help to determine the cause. While the evidence initially points to error, a new autopsy reveals another line of inquiry, which ends in the investigators racing to prevent another accident. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A woman stops taking her medication and kills 10 people with her car - but the blame for the offence falls on a former rock star waging a campaign against psychiatric drugs. Under pressure from Cragen, a sympathetic Novak has no choice but to pursue a prosecution - and the trial attracts intense media attention. Guest starring Norman Reedus (The Walking Dead).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson visits a woman who arrived at the hospital with her head shaved, having been raped. When the victim refuses to submit to testing, unorthodox methods are called for to acquire evidence, but further investigation reveals the case has implications beyond sexual assault. Drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Kristen Bush.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Tutuola search for a kidnapped 17-year-old girl with a genetic condition that makes her appear much younger than she is, afraid she may have fallen into the clutches of a paedophile. As the case progresses, they find compelling evidence that the abduction was staged, and that the so-called victim had her own reasons for wanting to disappear. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Ice-T.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and new partner Beck investigate the rape of a woman who has accused a high-profile lawyer of the crime, but have difficulty proving their case. Another victim emerges with fresh evidence against the alleged assailant, but her testimony soon proves far from reliable. Guest starring Robin Weigert (Deadwood), with Connie Nielsen.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Beck arrest a homeless man on suspicion of the rape and murder of a woman and her 10-year-old daughter - only to find he is actually Munch's estranged uncle Andrew (guest star Jerry Lewis). As the case proceeds, a new suspect is identified, but the evidence against him is thrown out in court - and events build to a tragic conclusion. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Connie Nielsen.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nick and Riley investigate an attack on a skydiver who was critically injured when his parachute failed to open. Meanwhile, Catherine and Greg are called to a double murder and it seems the two cases share a surprising connection. Elsewhere, Langston struggles to solve the death of a religious fanatic in the desert as Brass questions the prime suspect, one of the victim's followers. George Eads stars.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare 911
programme.desc: A police 911 operator is fired after mistaking a real murder for a prank call, and feeling guilty for allowing the crime to happen, she sets out to find the killer herself before he or she strikes again. Thriller, starring Fiona Gubelmann, Scott Bailey and John Lee Ames.(n)

programme.title: False Pretenses
programme.desc: A woman's life is left in tatters when her wealthy husband finds he has been conned out of millions by his best friend, and kills himself. Escaping the painful memories, she moves elsewhere and slowly begins to rebuild her life - until the conman hunts her down. Thriller, starring Peta Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Double Exposure
programme.desc: A maker of motivational films based on subliminal messages uses his expertise to plant a subconscious command in the mind of a rival to lure him to his death. However, any hopes of his getting away with it are dashed by the arrival of a certain shabby sleuth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Culp, Robert Middleton, Louise Latham and Arlene Martel.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Publish or Perish
programme.desc: A ruthless publisher hires a hitman to kill a best-selling author who has threatened to sign with a rival company - but reckons without the involvement of the cigar-smoking sleuth, who is determined to put the culprit behind bars. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Mickey Spillane, Jack Cassidy and John Chandler.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Lovely but Lethal
programme.desc: A cosmetics company is rocked by the revelation that a pirated version of their latest product is on the market, and then, shortly afterwards, one of their chemists is found murdered. But when the shabby sleuth scrutinises the case, he suspects the events are linked to a rival company. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Vincent Price, Martin Sheen and Vera Miles.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A blogger who devoted his energies to exposing corruption within government is found dead and it transpires he had recently suggested that some Navy Seals had overstepped the mark in their use of force. As the team gets to grips with the case hoping the claims are wrong, another body turns up with its tongue removed, and near the body a hair is found that guides investigators to a suspect - a Navy Seal. However, the possibility that the team is being deliberately led astray remains. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The Navy's finest female pilot dies at an air show while demonstrating a state-of-the-art aircraft about to be brought into service. Fearing the press will have a field day over the capability of women pilots, a senior Navy officer calls for the team's help to determine the cause. While the evidence initially points to error, a new autopsy reveals another line of inquiry, which ends in the investigators racing to prevent another accident. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A hit-and-run driver kills a man working on the campaign for an aspiring senator, but it soon becomes a case of national security when closer examination of the video footage makes it clear he was murdered. The agents' job is to figure out whether it is an isolated incident or part of a politically motivated plot that might put others in danger - and most of the pressure is on Kensi, who takes the victim's old job and goes undercover in the campaign office.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac uncovers a murder on board a commercial flight from New York to Washington DC and sets up a makeshift crime lab to catch the killer. The case takes an unexpected twist with the discovery that the victim, an escaped convict with a history of drug-running, was posing as a federal air marshal to smuggle cash out of the country.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Evidence found at a murder scene links the victim to a number of high-profile figures, including police chief Brigham Sinclair and the benefactor who made Hawkes' career possible. The detectives learn the killer stole a data stick, but find their inquiries hindered by a private investigator trying to suppress sensitive information about his employer. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Mykelti Williamson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A rapist begins to escalate his crimes, attacking victims more than once - and Dr Huang suspects he has a particularly disturbing motive for targeting them. However, tensions flare between Stabler and Beck as they make a difficult decision to help catch whoever is responsible. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: La Soga
programme.desc: A disgraced Dominican cop fights to clear his name and avenge his father's death in this gritty revenge thriller from director Joshua Crook (Salvage, Rockaway). Luisito's father was an honest butcher who valued hard work. He was a positive role model for a kid from the slums, and Luisito's life was forever changed when notorious drug dealer Rafa (Paul Calderon) shot him down in cold blood. Flash-forward two decades, and Luisito is doing his part to keep the Dominican Republic safe from the criminal element. He's been carefully molded into the perfect crime fighter thanks to the charismatic General Colon (Juan Fernández), who exploited Luisito's childhood trauma before inducting him into the secret police. As a young boy, Luisito fell deeply in love with Jenny. But when Jenny's family moved to New York shortly after Luisito's father was killed, they lost touch. Now, Jenny (Denise Quiñones) is back in the Dominican Republic, and her feelings for Luisito are stronger than ever. If only Luisito could find a way to tell her about his work, perhaps they could find a way to make love work. Unfortunately for Luisito and Jenny, an investigation into General Colon's recent activities reveals an epic betrayal, and sets the stage for a tragic confrontation(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realize that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: William Friedkin's multi-Oscar-winning gritty urban crime drama tells the real-life story of two New York narcotics cops' attempts to bring down a French drugs kingpin. Gene Hackman and Roy Scheider play detectives James 'Popeye' Doyle and Buddy Russo who, while investigating relatively minor-league drugs pushers, learn that a massive shipment of very pure heroin is about to arrive in the city. The heroin is being imported from Marseille by Alain Charnier, who is prepared to do anything, including murdering policemen, to get his narcotics out on the streets. But, although they know it's on its way, Doyle and Russo don't know how. Additionally, they make life more difficult for themselves by their warring with FBI agent Mulderig, who's also working the case. Hickman was the stunt driver pursued by Steve McQueen in Bullitt; and was also behind the wheel for the famous chase in this movie, which was shot in real traffic(n)

programme.title: Dark Water

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: A CIA agent attempts to track down the leader of a Jordanian terrorist cell by inventing a fictitious rival group. programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: Tense American football drama about an ageing coach holding his team together through a losing streak. Ownership of the team is inherited by a determined young businesswoman who increases the pressure to come up with winning results. programme.desc: Sue Barker presents coverage of the ladies' singles final between Garbine Muguruza and Venus Williams at the All England Club. Muguruza's previous two Grand Slam finals were both against Venus' sister Serena, and she experienced mixed fortunes in them. She lost the first one here in 2015, before gaining revenge in the French Open last year. Her 37-year-old opponent has become the oldest Grand Slam singles finalist since Martina Navratilova finished runner-up here in 1994, and is looking for her sixth Wimbledon title, but her first since 2008.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: The choral music contest reaches its fifth heat, as another six diverse groups seek to demonstrate their vocal skills. This time, the ensembles are young chamber choir Tring Park 16, West Midlands-based musical theatre enthusiasts Crescendo, Oxford University a capella group Oxford Alternotives, classical quintet Vox-Xover, all-girl pop ensemble Vocalities, and Dublin barbershop choir The Ramparts. Each group is given a chance to display their speciality with a `showstopper' performance, before battling it out with their rivals in a themed `riff-off'. Guest judge Joe Jonas joins Gareth Malone and Kelis on the panel. Postponed from Saturday 8th July.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tensions between Jez, Iain, Mickey and Scott look set to reach fever pitch after Mickey is brought in to the ED, having been injured during a police chase following a race-related assault on a shopkeeper. Desperate to keep his relationship secret from his hardline brother Scott, Mickey puts on a front and insults Jez, but when Iain realises Scott has intimidated the shopkeeper's wife into silence, he decides to make use of his knowledge to ensure justice is done. Meanwhile, Max takes an interest in attractive mortuary assistant Tara during a speed-dating session at the Hope & Anchor, but the situation becomes complicated after Tara faints, resulting in an illuminating trip back to the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Die Hard with a Vengeance
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane returns to duty following an explosion at a department store in the city. The perpetrator contacts the police and tells them that unless McClane and an unfortunate bystander who was in the wrong place at the wrong time carry out a series of instructions to the letter, more bombs will be detonated. Action thriller sequel, starring Bruce Willis, Samuel L Jackson and Jeremy Irons.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Natasha Raskin lend their expertise to two teams at Norfolk Antiques Fair, while presenter Thomas Plant learns how Norfolk schoolchildren went on strike in 1914.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker and guests look ahead to the men's singles final at the All England Club, as Marin Cilic and Roger Federer look to succeed 2016 champion Andy Murray on Centre Court.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Marin Cilic v Roger Federer. Sue Barker presents coverage of the men's singles final on Centre Court at SW19. Croatian Cilic has reached only his second Grand Slam final, having previously appeared in - and won - the showpiece match at the 2014 US Open. Legendary Swiss player Federer is looking for a record eighth triumph at Wimbledon, and 19th Major overall. Home favourite Andy Murray picked up his second Wimbledon title here in 2016, defeating Canada's sixth seed Milos Raonic 6-4, 7-6, 7-6 to claim his third major title overall, following his famous triumph here over Novak Djokovic in 2013 and the 2012 US Open, when he defeated the same player in the final. The Scot is currently world number one and came into this tournament as top seed, so hopes were high a fortnight ago for another strong run at his home event.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison visits a Scottish island that is home to the largest puffin colony on Britain's east coast, and Sean Fletcher investigates the history of fruit growing in Fife. Plus, Tom Heap reports on the spread of bovine TB among goats and Adam Henson joins a member of Ordnance Survey as he maps field margins.(n)

programme.title: Fake or Fortune
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and art experts Philip Mould and Bendor Grosvenor come to the aid of a man who has inherited three paintings that he believes were painted by LS Lowry. However, he cannot prove whether they are the genuine article, and since Lowry is the British artist whose work is most frequently forged, it will take a great deal of evidence to convince the art establishment of their value. The search for the truth leads to a discovery that challenges established beliefs about the artist's life.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross gives some of Nampara's land to the peasants so that they can provide for themselves, while he and Demelza also come to the aid of Dwight, who is terribly traumatised by his experiences of imprisonment in France. George tries to force Morwenna into marriage to further his political ambitions - an arrangement that Geoffrey unwittingly lets slip to Drake.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Birmingham landlord Samuel is just 25 but already has a portfolio of 13 properties worth more than £1million in total, and lives off the combined rental income with his wife Amanda. The couple spend a week living in one of their houses, rented by mother-of-two Marie, to experience life from her perspective. Also taking part are husband-and-wife duo Paul and Sharon from Weston-super-Mare, Somerset, who move into a two-bedroom flat rented by Chris and Courtney. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Sylvia Scarlett
programme.desc: A French criminal is forced to flee the country with her equally crooked father and resorts to disguising herself as a boy to avoid attention. Her secret is discovered by a suave English jewel thief, who invites them to join forces with him. Romantic comedy, starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant, Brian Aherne and Edmund Gwenn.(n)

programme.title: A Walk in the Sun
programme.desc: A US Army infantry patrol joins the 1943 invasion of Italy, and a series of casualties leaves a corporal in charge of the men. They are selected for a special mission to seize a farmhouse that German forces have turned into a fortified hideout. Second World War adventure, starring Dana Andrews, Richard Conte and Sterling Holloway.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty catches two blue sharks that have crossed the Atlantic and attaches tags to their dorsal fins so their migration routes can be tracked. He is also called to investigate surprising reports that a dolphin has begun attacking swimmers.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Coverage of the ladies' wheelchair singles and men's wheelchair doubles finals, on the penultimate day of action at the third Grand Slam tournament of the year.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate quality produce that needs to be cooked with the respect it deserves, as they continue their culinary journey through time. The duo argue that, while convenience food serves a purpose, only the best ingredients and perfect cooking can produce something truly delicious.(n)

programme.title: Forbidden Planet
programme.desc: Space travellers journey to an unexplored world, where another spaceship disappeared without trace 20 years previously. They find the planet inhabited only by mysterious scientist Dr Morbius, his beautiful daughter and their robot servant. However, Morbius doesn't take kindly to intruders entering his domain and it soon becomes clear that sinister forces are at work beneath the planet's idyllic facade. Sci-fi drama loosely based on Shakespeare's The Tempest, starring Walter Pidgeon, Anne Francis, Leslie Nielsen and Warren Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Aaron Shah, who has been captivated by his grandmother's home movies of a trip Down Under, tries to persuade his partner Amy they should move from the North of England to Australia as they sample life in Adelaide for a week.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: A millionaire tries to save jungle tigers on the Indonesian island of Sumatra by capturing them in their natural habitat, then transporting them to his own land and setting them free. However, zoologist Alan Rabinowitz is unsure about the wisdom of his scheme, particularly given the dangers the big cats pose to humans, and decides to investigate further.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and Will Axon assess items at Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, including a Busby hat and a Worcester coffee set. Presenter Paul Martin explores the Battle of Edgehill.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents coverage of the men's and ladies' doubles finals from SW19, on the 13th day of this year's tournament. The men's final in 2016 was an all-French affair, with top seeds Nicolas Mahut and Pierre-Hugues Herbert defeating Julien Benneteau and Edouard Roger-Vasselin in straight sets. In the ladies' final, just hours after her singles final victory over Angelique Kerber, Serena Williams paired up with sister Venus to take the title for a sixth time.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the day's play, where the ladies' singles final was the main attraction on Centre Court. The host also casts her eye over the men's and ladies' doubles finals, and presents a round-up of the latest news, as the famous event drew ever closer to a finish.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Imagine: Chris Ofili - The Caged Bird's Song.
programme.desc: Alan Yentob catches up with celebrated Turner Prize-winning artist Chris Ofili, as he completes work on The Caged Bird's Song, a new piece set to receive its exhibition debut at London's National Gallery. Best known as a painter, Ofili switches mediums with his latest piece, working alongside expert weavers in Edinburgh to create a wool tapestry seven meters wide and three meters tall. With The Caged Bird's Song, Ofili aims to demonstrate his ongoing fascination with classical mythology and contemporary `demigods', while also paying tribute to the landscape of his adopted island home of Trinidad.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar, Tiff Stevenson and Tom Allen (the latter having just appeared romping around on Channel 4's Crystal Maze). As usual, the contestants engage in various rounds of topical stand-up and improvisation as they try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the quiz show, making a meal of some M-themed food topics as Cariad Lloyd, Dermot O'Leary and Phill Jupitus compete alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sitcom star and The Last Leg regular Josh Widdicombe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He'll be warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Londoner Nathan Caton and Celia Pacquola from Australia.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents highlights of the third round of the European Tour event at Dundonald Links in Troon, Ayrshire, where Alexander Noren entered as the defending champion.(n)

programme.title: Salvage
programme.desc: A mysterious and deadly creature escapes from a sunken cargo ship and hides out in a suburban neighbourhood. As paranoia grips the populace and the military try to cover things up, a woman desperately searches for her missing daughter - only to come face to face with the monster. Horror, starring Neve McIntosh, Shaun Dooley and Linzey Cocker.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter V, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Danny Clarke transform a dank Victorian garden in Sunderland into an inviting space for the owner's grandchildren.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to prune summer flowering shrubs, makes plans for autumn flowers and returns to Dublin to find out how Helen Dillon is progressing in her new garden. Joe Swift shows how good design should not hinder challenging conditions when he visits a garden in Kent, Rachel de Thame explores the vital role of scent in wild flowers and the insects that visit them, and Nick Bailey prepares designs for a weekend project that will transform a front garden into a beautiful and practical space. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a groundbreaking project in Northamptonshire to incorporate wildlife conservation into a retail park. John Craven visits a micro-tannery and goes in search of an elusive butterfly, Adam Henson finds out about an insect farm in Cumbria, and Tom Heap reports on homelessness in rural areas.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's wheelchair singles and ladies' wheelchair doubles finals, on the closing day of action at the third Grand Slam tournament of the year.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel focuses on dishes that bring people together, heading to Trowbridge in Wiltshire to discover what draws Moroccan families around a traditional lamb tagine. He also gets a lesson in the art of pairing spices for an Indonesian fish dish and meets Zoe, who shows him how to make Ghanaian jollof rice. Inspired by their recipes, Nigel creates a Sunday roast of pork belly and shredded duck with spiced flatbread.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their culinary journey through time by celebrating Britain's numerous food festivals. The duo reveal the fascinating stories behind the events and sample some of the dishes on offer.(n)

programme.title: Father of the Bride Part II
programme.desc: A put-upon father has just got used to his daughter being married, when he learns she is pregnant. Thrown into a mid-life crisis, he impulsively sells his house so he and his wife can buy the seafront retreat they had always dreamed about - only for responsibility to come crashing back on him when his wife reveals she is also expecting. Comedy sequel, starring Steve Martin and Diane Keaton.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Emma Turley and Ceri Wilson have a pleasant enough life in Manchester, but Emma has recently had a growing feeling that New Zealand could offer the couple more. Ceri is on board with the idea, but thinks a move could be a big gamble, and a week in Auckland shows the couple the grass is not always greener on the other side. However, it remains to be seen whether they will decide to follow their hearts and relocate Down Under. Presented by Nicki Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Meerkats: Secrets of an Animal Superstar.
programme.desc: Meerkat pups Squirt and Weeny belong to one of the most famous animal families on the planet and are also part of a 20-year animal behaviour study. David Attenborough narrates the full story of the research, from the early days when it was a challenge to even get close to a meerkat to the latest revelations about these animals and their complex lives.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones and Mike Peters from the Alarm join a charity walk in the Welsh hills for NHS cancer services, while Kate Bottley meets a royal composer at St Asaph Cathedral.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Mark Stacey help two teams to look for bargains at the RAF Museum in Hendon, London, while Paul Martin visits an exhibition of First World War flying pioneers.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents coverage of the mixed doubles final at the All England Club, as 2016 champions Henri Kontinen and Heather Watson face Jamie Murray and Martina Hingis. Finnish player Kontinen and home favourite Watson caused one of the fairytale stories of last year's event, defeating defending champions Hingis and Leander Paes in the third round and eventually overcoming Robert Farah and Anna-Lena Groenefeld 7-6, 6-4 in the final.(n)

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: Premiere. A lawyer is left for dead after an ambush in which his Texas ranger brother is killed, but is saved by a mysterious Native American fugitive. Concealing his identity behind a mask, he and his new ally hunt down the outlaws behind the attack - only to find their actions are just part of a larger evil scheme. Western, starring Armie Hammer, Johnny Depp and Helena Bonham Carter. Includes Lotto.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding and guests look back at highlights of the men's singles final, where the third Grand Slam title of the year was set to be decided. Plus, news from the rest of the day's finals as the famous tournament was brought to a conclusion, and a review of this year's staging of the event.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents highlights of the final round of the European Tour event at Dundonald Links in Troon, Ayrshire, where Alexander Noren entered as the defending champion.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Lost Waterlands: Escape to Swallows and Amazons Country
programme.desc: Presenters Dick Strawbridge and Professor Alice Roberts explore the British landscapes that inspired children's author Arthur Ransome to write his famous series Swallows and Amazons. Strawbridge uses vintage boats to investigate three iconic waterlands - the Lake District, the Norfolk broads, and the Suffolk coastline - while Roberts takes a look at the shore lines.(n)

programme.title: The Last Seabird Summer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following Adam Nicolson and the seabirds of the Shiants, a cluster of Scottish islands in the Outer Hebrides. As the puffins, guillemots and razorbills arrive from far out in the North Atlantic, Adam traces people's long history of dependence on seabirds - thousands of years of collecting eggs and hunting the birds for meat, oil and feathers.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: New series. An amnesiac is found disoriented on a highway, and when he is admitted to hospital, he learns his niece has disappeared. Spanish thriller, starring Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Juan Elias' own partner Ricardo remains sceptical about his amnesia, and Eva tries to disassociates herself with the case. Spanish thriller, starring Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Gary Davies introduce performances by Galaxy, the Weather Girls, Sade, Bananarama, Howard Jones, Tracey Ullman and Nena. First shown March 8, 1984.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Music compilation show celebrating some of the most popular boy bands to have graced TV screens since the 1960s. The programme highlights performances by acts defined by vocal harmonies, synchronised dance-steps and character appeal, including JLS, the Four Tops, the Monkees, Westlife, Village People and Blazin' Squad.(n)

programme.title: Rollermania: Britain's Biggest Boy Band
programme.desc: Members of the classic Bay City Rollers line-up, including Les McKeown, recall how they went from humble beginnings playing pubs and clubs across Scotland to achieving pop stardom in the 1970s. They also reveal the dark side that dogged the band behind the scenes, including their relationship with manager Tam Paxton, bankruptcy, legal battles and division between the band members. Featuring rarely seen archive footage from the era, plus contributions from the band's songwriters, producers and record company promoters.(n)

programme.title: The Richest Songs in the World
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe presents a countdown of the 10 songs that have earned the most money of all time, along with the stories behind them. He also explains how music royalties work and reveals the biggest winners and losers in the history of popular music.(n)

programme.title: Lucy Worsley: Mozart's London Odyssey
programme.desc: The broadcaster traces the forgotten story of the young Mozart's adventures in Georgian London. Arriving in 1764 as an eight year old boy, the city held the promise of unrivalled musical opportunity. But in telling the telling the tale of Mozart's strange and unexpected encounters, Lucy Worsley reveals how life wasn't easy for the little boy in a big city. She also reveals how his experiences in London inspired his achievements.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Daniel Barenboim conducts German orchestra Staatskappelle Berlin in a concert of music by English composers at the Royal Albert Hall, including Elgar's Second Symphony and the premiere of Deep Time, a new piece by Harrison Birtwistle. Introduced by Tom Service.(n)

programme.title: John Denver: Country Boy
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the private life and public legacy of singer-songwriter John Denver, America's original `country boy', who died in 1997. The programme features the accounts of those closest to him, revealing the man behind the music.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Asteroids - The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.
programme.desc: Scientists and researchers analyse recent discoveries about asteroids, and how their studies suggest smaller rocks could pose a threat as they head toward Earth. The experts explain the photon propulsion that powers their journey across space and how some of these travellers carry a cargo of frost and ice that could have helped to start life on Earth.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Only Easy Day Is Yesterday.
