programme.desc: Iain Lee presents a compilation of internet videos featuring dogs, including two labradors plotting an elaborate cookie heist and the UK's smallest canine, which is only 13 inches long. With contributions from Des Clarke, Zoe Lyons and Marek Larwood.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Cats Make You Laugh Out Loud 4.
programme.desc: Iain Lee narrates a compilation of videos featuring cats doing bizarre and humorous things, including internet celebrity Pompous Albert and a feline rock climber. With contributions from Andi Osho, Felicity Ward and Scott Capurro.(n)

programme.title: Racing Stripes
programme.desc: A farmer reluctantly agrees to adopt a zebra left behind by a travelling circus - but is astonished to discover the animal has an amazing talent for racing and decides to enter it in a big competition. Family comedy adventure, starring Hayden Panettiere and Bruce Greenwood, with the voices of Frankie Muniz, Dustin Hoffman, Mandy Moore and Snoop Dogg.(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: A mischievous trio of talking chipmunks invade a struggling songwriter's home. When the furry critters demonstrate a remarkable talent for singing, he agrees to help them find fame and fortune. However, an unscrupulous record company boss has other plans. Children's comedy, starring Jason Lee and David Cross, with the voices of Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler and Jesse McCartney.(n)

programme.title: FIA Formula E Live
programme.desc: The second New York ePrix race. Coverage of the second of two races staged at the Brooklyn Street Circuit in New York, which serves as the 10th round of the season.(n)

programme.title: Cricket on 5
programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: Second Test Day Three.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the third day's play in the Second Test of the four-match series, which took place at Trent Bridge in Nottingham. With commentary by Graeme Smith, Geoffrey Boycott, Simon Hughes, Michael Vaughan and Mark Nicholas.(n)

programme.title: That's So
programme.desc: An entertaining reflection on the year, which saw the wedding of Lady Diana Spencer and Prince Charles draw a global record audience of 750 million people, US president Ronald Reagan and Pope John Paul II survive assassination attempts, the first Rubik's Cube world championship, the Magic Stick become the latest must-have toy and in music the emergence of the New Romantic era.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Cops Schmidt and Jenko hated each other when they were at school together, but have grown up to become friends. They are forced to relive the horrors of their adolescence when their captain decides their youthful appearance makes them the perfect undercover agents to crack a high-school drug ring. Comedy inspired by the 1980s TV series, with Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum. Includes 5 News Update at 11pm.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines, sports news and weather.(n)

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Cops Schmidt and Jenko hated each other when they were at school together, but have grown up to become friends. They are forced to relive the horrors of their adolescence when their captain decides their youthful appearance makes them the perfect undercover agents to crack a high-school drug ring. Comedy inspired by the 1980s TV series, with Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum. Includes 5 News Update at 11pm.(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Based on the true story of the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig, which caused an oil spill. The worst U.S. oil spill disaster in history(n)

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel while succumbing to greed(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis' comedy-adventure stars Kathleen Turner as Joan Wilder, a reclusive best-selling writer. But when Joan receives a message from her sister saying she's been kidnapped in Colombia, she heads south to help her. Ending up stranded in the middle of nowhere, she bumps into adventurer Jack T Colton who offers to help her and the two become involved in not just a search for her sister but a fabulous precious stone. Hindering them are inept villains Ralph and Ira and a local bandit chief who happens to be Joan's number one fan... Edited for content(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: Can a high-attitude African-American politician who says what he thinks stand a chance in a presidential campaign? Mays Gilliam (Chris Rock) is a straight-talking alderman representing a inner-city neighborhood in Washington, D.C. In the midst of a hard-fought race for the White House, the Democratic presidential and vice-presidential candidates are killed in an airline crash, and with little time to prepare a new campaign, the Republican candidate, Vice President Brian Lewis (Nick Searcy), seems all but guaranteed to win. With practically nothing to loose, party head Martin Geller (Dylan Baker) approaches Gilliam and asks him to stand as the Democrat's presidential candidate. While Gilliam is dubious at first, before long his streetwise style and willingness to face the issues head-on earns him surprising figures in the polls, especially after he persuades his short-fused older brother, Mitch Gilliam (Bernie Mac), to join the ticket as vice presidential candidate -- a big jump for a bail bondsman. Gilliam's love life also becomes more complicated as his ex-girlfriend Kim (Robin Givens) decides she wants him back now that he has a shot at the White House, even though Gilliam only has eyes for Lisa (Tamala Jones). Head of State marked the directorial debut for comic and actor Chris Rock, who also co-wrote and co-produced the film(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: A young artist struggling with his career and his muse is getting more than a little aggravation from Cupid in this romantic comedy written and directed by Woody Allen. Jerry Falk (Jason Biggs) is a promising 21-year-old comedy writer living in New York City. While Jerry has talent, he's having a hard time getting his career off the ground, which might have something to do with the fact his agent Harvey (Danny DeVito) is a well-meaning, but ineffectual, blowhard, and his mentor David Dobel (Allen) is an increasingly paranoid eccentric whose twin careers as a teacher and standup comic are both floundering. Poised at the top of Jerry's mountain of anxieties is his relationship with his girlfriend Amanda (Christina Ricci); from the first moment he saw her, Jerry has been in love with her, but Amanda's multiple neuroses, fear of commitment, and frustrating intimacy issues make her all but impossible to be around. Jerry is approaching his breaking point when the small flat he shares with Amanda becomes home to a third roommate -- Amanda's mother Paula (Stockard Channing), who has decided to come to New York to chase her dream of becoming a cabaret singer. Anything Else also features supporting performances from Jimmy Fallon, William Hill, and jazz vocalist Diana Krall(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: Following a werewolf attack, nerdy siblings Ellie and Jimmy enjoy the benefits of animal magnetism. It's fun for a while, but too many people are dying and time is running out for them to find the original beast, kill it and break the curse(n)

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: An extremely bright young man, thinking that he's sneaking an advance look at a new line of video games, breaks into the country's Norod missile-defence system and challenges it to a game of global thermonuclear warfare(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated in this tense sci-fi thriller. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: A cop tangles with demons and angels when she probes her twin's death with a man who has literally been to hell and back. Stylized but muddled supernatural thriller based on the "Hellblazer" graphic novels(n)

programme.title: Alien: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: The crew of a spacecraft fight off a terrifying extra-terrestrial invader in Ridley Scott's cut of his sci-fi classic(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Sci-fi sequel in which Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) wakes up after years in suspended animation to discover the alien nightmare beginning all over again. Contains violence(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: Alien 3 takes place on Fiorina 161, a former maximum-security correctional facility inhabited by a community of ex-prisoners. Onto this prison world crashes Warrant Officer Ellen Ripley. Ripley soon finds that she has brought along one of the deadly extraterrestrials that she battled before. Once the alien is discovered, the inhabitants of Fiorina 161, who have no advanced technology or modern weapons, fight back with Ripley's help(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: Ellen Ripley returns from the dead, courtesy of cloning, to battle more beasts(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: When business executive Lee Cullen uncovers a plot to deliver a super-weapon into enemy hands, she is assigned to the witness protection programme under US Marshal John 'Eraser' Kruger. But just who is hunting Lee down? Action(n)

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: Set in 1959, Diner shows how five young men resist their adulthood and seek refuge in their beloved Diner(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: A CIA agent attempts to track down the leader of a Jordanian terrorist cell by inventing a fictitious rival group. In the process he deliberately implicates an innocent architect and almost causes the death of his Iranian love interest, while trying to placate the xenophobic boss who commands him from America(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Kaufman gave performances that were bizarre and difficult to categorize, in which he might do or say almost anything: show cartoons, impersonate Elvis Presley, play conga drums while singing children's songs, read aloud from The Great Gatsby, or take the audience out for milk and cookies. Written by Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski and directed by Milos Forman (the team behind The People vs. Larry Flynt (1996)), this biopic takes an in-depth look at Kaufman's life and art, with Jim Carrey as Kaufman, who could (and would) be any number of different people onstage: the quiet and childlike man, the little foreign guy, the overbearing showbiz "professional," the violently obnoxious wrestler, or the world's worst lounge singer. As Kaufman rose from comedy clubs to guest appearances on Saturday Night Live and a spot on the TV sitcom Taxi, his performances became more complex and dangerous -- so much so that when word got out in 1984 that he was suffering from lung cancer, many fans and associates thought it was just another bizarre stunt; the disease took his life later that year. Man on the Moon features Danny De Vito as Kaufman's manager George Shapiro, Courtney Love as his girlfriend Lynne Margulies, Paul Giamatti as his friend Bob Zmuda, and David Letterman, Judd Hirsch, Marilu Henner, Carol Kane, and Christopher Lloyd as themselves(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A neurologist investigates the case of a young boy who has somehow repeatedly cheated death after the youth survives yet another near-fatal accident on his ninth birthday. As the doctor becomes obsessed with this mystery, he also develops romantic feelings for the boy's mother(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: In this exhilarating drama based on true events, legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Blockbuster sequel with Bruce Willis reprising his role as maverick cop John McClane. This time, McClane must pull out all the stops to save New York from a crazed bomber(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: An intense character study about two motorists whose lives become intertwined after a fender bender on a New York expressway(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The powerful true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax

programme.desc: When Jeff's girlfriend is abducted by a highly intelligent psychopath, his only hope of finding her is to put himself in the kidnapper's hands(n)

programme.desc: Planet Earth stands on the brink of destruction as alien visitor Klaatu arrives to deliver a grave warning(n)

programme.title: Castle Ghosts of Scotland
programme.desc: Castle Ghosts of Scotland explores the eerie grounds of three of Scotland's most haunted castles: Glamis, Duntrune, and Fyvie. With a history every bit as bloody and treacherous as Shakespeare's +MacBeth, it's no wonder Scotland has so many ghosts. The childhood home of England's Queen Mother, Glamis Castle is reputed to be the most haunted castle in the United Kingdom -- despite resembling the Disney castle. In 1537, King James V accused the young and beautiful Lady Glamis of witchcraft. Burned at the stake, the ghost known as the "Grey Lady of Glamis" haunts the castle to this day. As the program travels to Aberdeenshire, Fyvie Castle's "Green Lady" ghost is revealed to be Dame Lillias Drummond, who was starved to death by her husband, Sir Alexander Seton. In 1615 during a feud between the McDonalds and the Campbells, a piper loyal to the McDonald clan had his fingers chopped off by the Campbells and bled to death. Current owners of the castle report strange knocking on doors, the sound of footsteps running -- and late at night, the soft strains of bagpipes being played in the tower(n)

programme.desc: The double-team version of the popular dinner-party challenge arrives in Worthing and Portsmouth, where three more couples put their culinary skills to the test. First up are pensioner duo Bill and Hilary, who surprise everyone with their liberal attitudes. Next to host are children's entertainer Doug and his ever-tolerant partner Patsy, who combine fine dining with hippy sensibilities, and finally, 22-year-old hip-hop enthusiasts Micaela and Sanchez prepare a menu with a Jamaican-Filipino twist. With all the evenings complete, the contestants convene one more time to determine the winners.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Combining remarkable demonstrations of abilities with revealing photography, Chris Packham travels the world to uncover the secrets of animals' intelligence, emotions and self-awareness. The first episode explores the remarkable ways creatures use their senses, examining how dogs' powerful ability to detect smell creates a bizarre alternative reality for them.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham continues his exploration of the minds of the cleverest animals on the planet by examining the problem-solving abilities of crows. He also investigates the extraordinary range of animal intelligence, examining bees that navigate, cockatoos that can pick locks and an ingenious octopus.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines why the most intelligent animals on the planet are also the most social. Swimming with a pod of dolphins in the Bahamas, he explores their language and learns how they are able to recognise themselves in a mirror. He also witnesses the deviousness of chimpanzees and watches elephants as they mourn their dead. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Broadcaster Clare Balding and vet Steve Leonard travel the world to watch vets perform innovative life-saving operations on a variety of wild animals. This first edition features a baby panda called Zhu Xia in south-west China that needs an MRI scan, and rescued gorilla Shufai in Cameroon, who was shot by poachers when he was a baby. Plus, a manta ray on the Japanese island of Okinawa that needs an ultra-sound scan to determine if it's pregnant, and a four-ton elephant in Laos with a gunshot wound.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to Japan where she visits inventor and vet Dr Keiichi Ueda. The vet has dedicated the past 12 years of his career to helping a dolphin called Fuji who has no tail as a result of a bacterial infection and he is hoping that a new prosthetic tail will enable her to swim properly again. Steve Leonard heads to the rainforest of Laos, where Edinburgh Zoo vet Romain Pizzi is undertaking keyhole surgery on a endangered moon bear called Champa who suffers from excess fluid on her brain. Steve then visits Florida where reptile specialist Doug Mader is using the latest technology to save Martha, an alligator with a badly blocked gut. Clare and Steve also follow the stories of a Galapagos tortoise with a mystery illness, a five-ton elephant suffering from an infected tusk and a tiger that keeps having nose bleeds.(n)

programme.title: I Survived a Fatal Flight
programme.desc: Documentary in which three people who were the lone survivors of aircraft crashes discuss their ordeals, detailing the conflicting emotions they experienced after realising everyone else on board had died. D-Day veteran Phil Bradley was trapped in his seat for 36 hours after the plane he was travelling on crashed in Virginia in 1959, while Annette Herfkens drank rainwater to stay alive after a Vietnam Airlines jet crashed into a mountain in 1992. Juliane Koepcke, meanwhile, tells of being lost for 10 days in the Peruvian rainforest after a plane crash in 1971, and how her knowledge of jungle terrain helped to save her life.(n)

programme.title: Hidden India
programme.desc: New series. Documentary exploring the wildlife and landscapes of India, beginning with an insight into how seasonal extremes pose a challenge for the subcontinent's wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Hidden India
programme.desc: The documentary series turns attention to the Western Ghats mountain range in the subcontinent's south, which shelters some of the greatest biodiversity in the world.(n)

programme.title: Hidden India
programme.desc: The documentary exploring India's rich landscape concludes by examining the Ganges river, on which hidden beaches provide a haven for thousand of young turtles. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: India's New Worlds
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary charting wildlife conservation projects in India, including efforts to avert the extinction of the Asiatic lion.(n)

programme.title: India's New Worlds
programme.desc: Concluding part of the documentary charting some of the many wildlife conservation projects currently being pursued in India.(n)

programme.title: Trainspotting
programme.desc: Smart, funny, sickly and sometimes just plain unconscious, Mark Renton is a hero for our times. Set in an underbelly of Edinburgh the city fathers never dreamed of, Trainspotting is the story of Mark and his so-called friends - a bunch of losers, liars, psychos, thieves and junkies. Hilarious but harrowing, the film charts the disintegration of their friendship as they proceed, seemingly inevitably, towards self-destruction. Mark alone has the insight and opportunity to escape his fate, but then again, does he really want to 'choose life'?(n)

programme.title: Friday the 13th, Part II
programme.desc: A killer terrorises a group of camp counsellors(n)

programme.title: Varsity Blues
programme.desc: A backup quarterback at a West Texas high school steps in for the injured starter and clashes with the gung ho coach(n)

programme.title: Face Off
programme.desc: Action thriller in which an FBI agent agrees to have the face of a captured international terrorist grafted onto his own head in order to discover the location of an enormous bomb. The plan goes awry when the terrorist, having assumed the agent's identity, escapes and destroys all evidence of the switch in a deadly game of cat and mouse(n)

programme.title: The Night Before
programme.desc: Three childhood friends who get together every Christmas Eve plan one last epic night out to celebrate the end of an era(n)

programme.title: Wet Hot American Summer
programme.desc: It's 1981 and the last day at a Maine summer camp, where both the counselors and the campers are looking for a good time.This hilarious spoof of the summer-camp films of the '70s and '80s features Janeane Garofalo as the chief counselor and David Hyde Pierce as the object of her affection. Written by Michael Showalter and David Wain of the sketch comedy The State. Paul Rudd, Molly Shannon, Amy Poehler, Christopher Meloni(n)

programme.title: Major League
programme.desc: Trying to throw the season, a scheming baseball owner goes out of her way to build the worst baseball team possible, bringing together a mismatched group of losers. Despite the odds against them, this team of misfits somehow manages to become an improbable winner in this sports comedy(n)

programme.desc: After air traffic controller Jack Chester loses a plane (it's covered on his screen by a fly), he's told to take a break. Jack books his family into a plush resort, but it turns out that their lodgings are in a hut by the beach. And that's as good as the vacation gets... 80s comedy(n)

programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life and forced to move cities. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Oscar-nominee Joaquin Phoenix plays Johnny Cash, and Oscar-winner Reese Witherspoon plays June Carter in James Mangold's acclaimed biographical film about country music's legendary 'Man in Black'. The film follows Cash from his childhood, where he was touched by tragedy, through his years on the road to his marriage to June Carter, who was country royalty (having been a part of the massively influential Carter Family band), and their struggle to find happiness as she weans him off booze and drugs. Walk the Line is a warts-and-all biopic, showing Cash's faults as well as his undoubted star quality as one of the greatest singer/songwriters that America has ever produced(n)

programme.desc: iable comedy-western starring James Garner as a conman who arrives in a remote gold-mining town controlled by two rival factions and is mistakenly identified as a fearsome gunslinger. The deception works in his favour, until the real fighter rolls into town. Co-starring Suzanne Pleshette and Joan Blondell. The sequel to Support Your Local Sheriff(n)

programme.desc: A hilarious and heartwarming comedy about a loser with money problems who pretends to be a mentally challenged athlete to rig the Special Olympics(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Desperate dad Robin Williams secretly poses as a Scottish nanny in order to spend time with his kids(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Tom Cruise plays Cole Trickle, a young hot-shot stock car racer determined to make it as top gun if he can find the right cocktail of car and manager, who comes along in the guise of racing legend Harry Hogge. As the pair tour the circuits, the climax builds up to Daytona and a showdown between Trickle and his arch-rival Russ Wheeler, who will stop at nothing to beat him. Tony Scott's all-action film captures the all-out excitement and speed of the sport, while Nicole Kidman as Dr Claire Lewicki provides the love interest(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Oscar-nominee Joaquin Phoenix plays Johnny Cash, and Oscar-winner Reese Witherspoon plays June Carter in James Mangold's acclaimed biographical film about country music's legendary 'Man in Black'. The film follows Cash from his childhood, where he was touched by tragedy, through his years on the road to his marriage to June Carter, who was country royalty (having been a part of the massively influential Carter Family band), and their struggle to find happiness as she weans him off booze and drugs. Walk the Line is a warts-and-all biopic, showing Cash's faults as well as his undoubted star quality as one of the greatest singer/songwriters that America has ever produced(n)

programme.title: Idiocracy
programme.desc: From Mike Judge, the creator of "Beavis and Butt-head" and "King of the Hill," comes this outrageous laughathon about a U.S. soldier (Luke Wilson) who gets involved in an experiment and awakens 500 years later in a world filled with dumb people, making him the smartest man on the planet. Maya Rudolph, Dax Shepard, Terry Alan Crews, David Herman, Michael McCafferty, Thomas Haden Church. Judge directed and co-wrote the script with Etan Cohen(n)

programme.title: Bowfinger
programme.desc: A group of wannabe filmmakers and actors concoct a scheme to make a movie with a major star- without having to pay him(n)

programme.title: Tank Girl
programme.desc: It is the year 2033 and Tank Girl, runs an army of half-men, half-kangaroo rebels known as the Rippers. Their sworn enemy is Kesslee has turned the world into a desolate wasteland by withholding the now-precious liquid from the majority of the population. Only Tank Girl, with her charm, impudence and sexuality, has the capability of taking Kesslee on, and he should not underestimate the power of a girl and her tank!(n)

programme.title: Highlander: Endgame
programme.desc: Christopher Lambert reprises his Connor MacLeod role for this splashy sequel, the third in the movie franchise. This time out, MacLeod's relaxing stay at a protective sanctuary is cut short after a new enemy murders most of the retreat's inhabitants. Bruce Payne, Adrian Paul, Lisa Barbuscia(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Experienced rafter Gail is introducing her family to the river she grew up on, when two dangerous strangers throw their vacation into jeopardy. Tense drama(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: This program salutes the legendary filmmaker who, during World War II, ran the Field Photographic Branch, a unit that shot a raft of documentaries that captured "the scope and sprawl of World War II." Kris Kristofferson is the narrator. Included are comments by Hollywood directors Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich; and critics Leonard Maltin, Andrew Sarris and Richard Schickel(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: George C Scott rightly won the best actor Oscar (one of seven the film won) for his portrayal of General George Patton, one of America's greatest Wwii commanders, whose successes in North Africa, Italy and Europe were offset by his massive ego and maverick attitudes, including his infamous slap and dressing down of a battle-fatigued soldier that saw him lose his command in Italy. Directed by Franklin J Schaffner from Francis Ford Coppola and Edmund H North's screenplay(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: The mysterious fifth element when combined with four others creates the ultimate weapon against universal evil. The story begins in 1914 when benign aliens visit an ancient Egyptian temple to steal four stones containing information about this mysterious element. The visitors promise to return to Earth in the future to save it from evil. Three centuries pass and Earth is threatened by a thunderous Cosmic Evil. Unfortunately, the Evil killed the Good aliens who promised to save the planet. Fortunately, Earthlings have a piece of one of the alien saviors. Utilizing DNA restructuring, scientists grow the piece into a perfect new alien which takes the form of a curvaceous, seductive no-holds barred redheaded acrobat who escapes from the lab with the police in hot pursuit. Desperately she dives into a cab reluctantly driven by luckless former special force officer (Bruce Willis) who suddenly finds himself faced with the task of saving the universe by finding the missing stones and vanquishing the evil forces. Featuring dazzling special effects and classy production values coupled with a healthy splash of outlandish high fashion the emphasis of Besson's film is not so much plot as it is over-the top spectacle(n)

programme.title: Drop Zone
programme.desc: Skydiving ace Ty Moncrief's aerial antics are costing the DEA in blood. Moncrief's team lands on federal buildings, steals files containing the names of undercover agents which Moncrief then sells to drug barons. Pete Nessip (an anagram of Snipes) is the marshal who takes the air to bring Ty down(n)

programme.desc: Five vacationing college teens make an unplanned stopover in an abandoned mountain cabin surrounded by dense woods, where they discover an ancient-looking occult tome. Later, an ominous presence from the depths of the forest emerges, and things quickly become life-threatening for the coeds(n)

programme.title: Pumpkinhead II: Blood Wings
programme.desc: A small-town cop has more to deal with than petty crime when his rebellious daughter resurrects the demonic Pumpkinhead(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teens must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: This program salutes the legendary filmmaker who, during World War II, ran the Field Photographic Branch, a unit that shot a raft of documentaries that captured "the scope and sprawl of World War II." Kris Kristofferson is the narrator. Included are comments by Hollywood directors Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich; and critics Leonard Maltin, Andrew Sarris and Richard Schickel(n)

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: This seminal western was one of the first films of the genre to depict Native Americans as real people rather than as tomahawk-wielding mass murderers. Set in Arizona in 1870, gold prospector Tom Jeffords is tired of the repetitive reprisal killings between settlers and the indigenous locals and plans a visit to the Apache leader, Cochise, to try and arrange a truce. But, after first being welcomed into the fold by Cochise, and even marrying the chief's daughter, old racial problems resurface(n)

programme.title: Hard Luck
programme.desc: Complicated thriller centering on a former criminal (Wesley Snipes) who is forced to go on the run after getting caught up in a drug deal gone bad. Cybill Shepherd, Mario Van Peebles (who also directed), Luis Guzmán(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: Sergeant Joe Enders is assigned as bodyguard to Ben Yahzee, a Navajo radio operator. After the Japanese crack their codes, the Americans use the Navajo language to keep their signals secret. Joe must keep the code safe from the enemy, even if it means killing Ben to protect it(n)

programme.title: 88 Minutes
programme.desc: Al Pacino stars as a college professor and forensic psychologist for the FBI who learns that he is scheduled to die in 88 Minutes. Professor Jack Gramm's skills are put to the test, with is own life at stake, as he attempts to decipher which of three suspects plans to kill him--problem graduate student Mike Stemp, Gramm's former girlfriend or a serial murderer he helped put on death row. Gramm knows when, but he must still discover who and how he is to die in this edge-of-your-seat thriller(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu Hustle
programme.desc: Director Stephen Chow made his name in this country with the deliriously wonderful Shaolin Soccer and Kung Fu Hustle continues his love of comedy kung-fu films. Set in pre-revolutionary China, Chow plays Sing, a street hustler who makes the mistake of pretending to be a member of the notorious Axe gang. He becomes caught up in a war between the gang and the residents of Pig Sty Alley, which the gang want to take over. Little do they know that two of the Alley's residents are retired martial arts experts and soon the fists and feet are flying in knockabout fights that owe as much to Kill Bill (some of the wire work is done by Yuen Wo Ping, who worked on Tarantino's film) as they do to classic Hollywood silent comedies. Film fans can enjoy Chow's references to films ranging from Top Hat to The Shining while the rest can just enjoy a wildly entertaining romp. In Cantonese with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police in Texas use a Taser to break up a bar fight, and officers in Florida are forced to step in when a dispute over a barking dog escalates into an armed stand-off.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Texas respond when a landlord is reported to have kicked a pregnant tenant in the stomach, while cops in Illinois deal with a slew of animals left in a mobile home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo confronts a man impersonating a Navy officer, which results in guns being drawn, and the only eyewitness to the case is the Special Agent's father - who is in town to disclose a secret to his son. The 250th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bomb detonates at a military charity concert, killing two men. Called to investigate, Tony and McGee try to determine whether the intended target was the 1980s rocker headlining the act or if the attack was part of a larger scheme against the military. Meanwhile, Jimmy prepares for parenthood. Keith Carradine guest stars, with Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gibbs joins forces with the FBI when the body of a congressman and former agent washes ashore in New Orleans. Together they try to determine if the murder could be linked to a well-known case the victim had previously worked on during his career. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. DiNozzo, McGee and the FBI continue to track political connections to a case, and Bishop sends DiNozzo a souvenir. Meanwhile, Gibbs and Special Agent Pride chase leads in New Orleans after evidence points to a copycat killer. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee's girlfriend Delilah makes a breakthrough in a case involving the alleged death of a US navy lieutentant. However, when her boss orders her to back away, she turns to the NCIS team for help. Meanwhile, McGee talks to DiNozzo about whether he should move forward with his relationship. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine sergeant falls to her death from a building, and when Gibbs and his team examine the circumstances, the woman's doctor urges him to consider this a murder investigation.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy lieutenant is murdered during a `tiger cruise', during which sailors' friends and relatives are invited aboard military vessels to spend the night on their ship.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The FBI's investigation into the death of Van Pelt's fiance comes to an end, just in time for her to help investigate the murder of a mob boss's son, who was killed while celebrating the prospect of taking control of the business from his ailing father. While Jane and the others focus their inquiries on the rest of the crime family, Grace takes the only witness in for interrogation, but is distracted by her own problems, and forced into a game of cat-and-mouse against a determined assassin. Drama, starring Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and Lisbon investigate the murder of an out-of-favour fashion designer who was planning to revitalise his career by launching a new clothing line, but first have to track down the man employed to make the outfits. Darcy continues to re-examine the Panzer case, talking to a blind woman who was friends with Red John - only for her to reveal the serial killer is still alive. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A woman looks set to be convicted of murdering her dance teacher, but Jane believes she is innocent after watching her give a press conference. He tries to prove she is not the killer before the jury's verdict is read out in court - so he announces that footage has been found of the crime taking place and waits to see who takes the bait. Crime drama, guest starring Ian Kahn, Diane Farr and James Frain, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A woman convicted of murdering her husband is given permission to leave jail for a few days to help Jane track down a former charity worker's killer, and they learn the philanthropist the victim once worked for is not as benevolent as he seems. However, as the case progresses, the consultant's new partner uses her charms to try to fool him and make a bid for her freedom. Crime drama, guest starring Morena Baccarin (Homeland), with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A man who wanted to expose the killer of the Visualise cult co-founder is murdered, leading the team to investigate old adversary Bret Stiles, who was photographed wearing a bloodied suit. As the sect's inner circle meets to elect a new leader, Jane hopes spreading a rumour will help him catch the culprit - but when nobody takes the bait, he has to change his tactics. Crime drama, guest starring Malcolm McDowell, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: County sheriff Rick Grimes wakes from a coma in an Atlanta hospital to find the world has been ravaged by an epidemic of zombies. He sets off on a journey to find his missing family, and meets two people who teach him the new rules for survival. Post-apocalyptic drama based on a comic book series, written and directed by Frank Darabont (The Shawshank Redemption), and starring Andrew Lincoln (This Life, Teachers).(n)

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: Rick is led to another band of survivors in a department store - but the sound of gunfire puts an undead horde on his trail, and an argument between two of his new comrades jeopardises the entire group's survival. Meanwhile, Lori grows closer to Shane - unaware that her husband is still alive. Post-apocalyptic thriller, starring Andrew Lincoln.(n)

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: Rick embarks on a perilous rescue mission, returning to zombie-ridden Atlanta to retrieve a bag of guns and save a man's life. Meanwhile, Lori struggles to deal with the unexpected return of her husband, especially in light of her blossoming romance with his best friend and old colleague Shane. Post-apocalyptic drama, starring Andrew Lincoln.(n)

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: Rick and his posse arrive in Atlanta, only to discover Merle has escaped from where they left him - but when they try to track him down, their party comes under attack from an unexpected source. Back at the camp, Jim's feverish rantings cause panic among his fellow survivors. Post-apocalyptic drama, starring Andrew Lincoln.(n)

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: Rick leads the group to the Centre for Disease Control after the attack on their camp, but faces a dangerous 100-mile trip. Jim reveals he has been bitten by a walker, while the Morales family decides to head to Alabama. Post-apocalyptic drama, starring Andrew Lincoln.(n)

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: Rick and his friends are elated when a strange doctor allows them to enter the CDC. However, things inside the supposed sanctuary are not quite what they seem. Post-apocalyptic drama, starring Andrew Lincoln.(n)

programme.title: Your Pretty Face Is Going to Hell
programme.desc: Satan introduces women to the workplace, and things quickly start to get a little steamy.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve suffers from back trouble and is forced to wear an unsightly brace. He refuses to attend school - until he discovers Stan has an embarrassing problem of his own. Meanwhile, Roger sneaks Hayley into a high-end spa, securing the attentions of an in-house detective.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is given pills by a colleague that enable him to stay awake all night so he can spend more time enjoying his hobbies, but when Francine discovers his nocturnal activities, she wants to join him. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger try to write a script for a pornographic film.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team must ascertain whether the murder of a Navy officer, whose body was found on a rural road, was the result of a bar fight or because he knew too much about an attack on a fellow female officer. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and McGee begin a juice detox to purge their bodies of impurities. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the disappearance of photographer Martin Roe, who was due to testify at an army first lieutenant's court-martial after he captured a picture of what appeared to be a soldier killing an unarmed civilian. However, the photograph is leaked, and Roe is later found dead with a needle in his arm.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Return of the American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service. Gibbs and McGee travel to Russia to escort a computer expert connected to classified intel. However, the mission is compromised and they are forced to go off the grid while being hunted by Russian mercenaries. Meanwhile, the team in DC frantically tries to locate the missing pair. Mark Harmon and Sean Murray star.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team examine the murder of a Shakespeare enthusiast and become suspicious of the victim's billionaire employer when he announces a $10million reward for information about the case, despite having a reputation for frugality. Meanwhile, FBI agent Susan Darcy enlists Jane's help to investigate the killing of a woman whose body was found in woods, and their only clue is a piece of glass from a wine bottle. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A wealthy man who had cancer is found murdered, despite only having weeks left to live, leaving the team suspecting one of his relatives could be to blame. Jane discovers his son was being cut out of the will and his wife was pretending to be ill in a con to win the affections of rich men. He is also led to a charlatan healer selling a special kind of tea after noticing an unusual smell on the body. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A casino security guard is killed and the team investigates his place of work, leading Jane to meet a magician he used to work with. He discovers his former colleague is planning to rob the business because his girlfriend has been kidnapped, and sets up a daring robbery as part of a live show in the hope of learning the murderer's identity. Crime drama, guest starring Christopher Judge, with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A popular teacher is found murdered and the team discovers hate mail in his bag. However, as the investigation gets under way, the agents discover the victim's behaviour had always been immaculate, ruling out any wrongdoing when traces of drugs are found in his car and a pupil accuses him of sleeping with a prostitute. Jane focuses on the relationship between the director of the school play and the lead actor, and even performs as an understudy to unravel more details about the crime. Starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Female impersonators come under suspicion when a man is found burnt to death on a cabaret bar's doorstep, but as Jane and the team investigate, they discover the victim was being bullied by more than one person, forcing them to try to lure the killer into the open. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.desc: With mutants and their human allies under threat, the X-Men send Wolverine back to the 70s to change their fate. Starring Hugh Jackman. Strong language/flashing images. (2014)(140 mins)(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: With mutants and their human allies under threat, the X-Men send Wolverine back to the 70s to change their fate. Starring Hugh Jackman. Strong language/flashing images. (2014)(140 mins)(n)

programme.title: Night Passage
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family falls in with a gang of outlaws plotting to rob a train operated by his strait-laced brother, but reckons without his sibling's determination to track him down and set him back on the straight and narrow. Western, starring James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea and Brandon de Wilde.(n)

programme.title: War of the Planet of the Apes Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Matt Reeves and star Andy Serkis talk about making the third film in the series.(n)

programme.title: Baggage Claim
programme.desc: An air hostess is horrified at the thought of her younger sister getting married while she is still single. She realises her job gives her access to eligible men from across America, and begins clocking up thousands of air miles as she scours the country for a potential fiance. Romantic comedy, with Paula Patton and Taye Diggs.(n)

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: An alcoholic former professional player reluctantly agrees to train an all-female baseball team during the Second World War. With star player Dottie Hinson and her sister Kit on board, they look set to dominate the league - until sibling rivalry rears its head. Comedy drama, starring Geena Davis, Lori Petty, Tom Hanks and Madonna.(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
programme.desc: In a future ravaged by war, the superhero team makes a desperate last stand against a force of deadly robots. Their only hope is to send Wolverine back in time to the 1970s, to join forces with an earlier version of the X-Men and change the events that started the conflict. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Hugh Jackman, Jennifer Lawrence, James McAvoy and Michael Fassbender.(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead
programme.desc: Five friends travel to a remote woodland cabin, hoping one of them can conquer her drug addiction by going cold turkey. They uncover a mysterious book that, when read, unleashes demonic forces that possess the living and transform them into bloodthirsty zombies. Horror remake, starring Jane Levy and Shiloh Fernandez.(n)

programme.title: The Duke of Burgundy
programme.desc: A butterfly expert develops a sexual relationship with her housekeeper based on sadomasochism. However, while the servant revels in her submissive role, her employer begins to grow weary of dominating her lover, placing a strain on their life together. Drama with an all-female cast, starring Sidse Babett Knudsen and Chiara D'Anna.(n)

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Spying
programme.desc: A secret formula is stolen by a sinister organisation masterminded by the evil Dr Crow. The British government plans to assign its top agents to deal with the crisis, but owing to staff shortages, has to settle for a bungling spy and his three hapless trainees. Comedy, starring Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Jim Dale, Eric Barker and Victor Maddern.(n)

programme.title: The Jewel of the Nile
programme.desc: A novelist travels to the Middle East to become a sheik's official biographer, only to end up being held hostage by him. Her lover joins forces with an old enemy to rescue her, but they get drawn into the hunt for a mysterious ancient treasure that has a connection to an eccentric holy man. Comedy adventure sequel to Romancing the Stone, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar.(n)

programme.title: War of the Planet of the Apes Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Matt Reeves and star Andy Serkis talk about making the third film in the series.(n)

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones.(n)

programme.title: Machete Kills
programme.desc: The relentless Mexican mercenary is hired by the president of the United States for a vitally important mission. A billionaire arms dealer intends to start a nuclear war using a space-based weapon of mass destruction, but defeating his schemes involves a deadly encounter with a murderous master of disguise. Action thriller sequel, starring Danny Trejo and Mel Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten reveals her cooking secrets. Ina sends a food lover's delight to a friend in the city. The package consists of a beautiful fillet of beef and a perfect plum tart.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten cooks a lunch of swordfish steaks in tomato caper sauce, saffron and courgette couscous followed by individual chocolate puddings.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: The delightful Ina Garten has some fun with her favourite fruity desserts. There's an explosive summer pudding, rum and raisin rice pudding and a classic key lime pie.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina has the solution to the scariest nightmare - your boss coming to dinner. Everyone's expecting something fancy so surprise them with the best comfort food - turkey meatloaf.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree puts a breakfast spin on four dinners, starting with sausage kale strata. Wild rice pancakes get flipped to dinnertime for the girls, while the boys enjoy breakfast quesadillas.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While Ree Drummond's daughter Alex and her friends have a dorm room craft day at college, Ree makes green chili chicken, spicy taco potatoes, layered Mexican salad and key lime pie.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: As the guys are away, Ree Drummond makes a blueberry crumb cake for breakfast, and petite filets with wasabi cilantro cream, lobster mac and cheese and lemony broccolini for dinner.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up a celebration dinner for her husband's birthday, with chili cheese burgers, crisp thin fries, a wedge salad and a yellow cake with a chocolate buttercream frosting.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Greek capital, where he heads to the street markets for his take on the local fast food - souvlaki and kebabs. The chef then learns how honey is made, teams up with a cheese-making priest and milks a goat, and prepares a selection of recipes including fisherman's stew, Greek salad, pistachio and honey cake, and a tuna dish.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Richman tries to drink nearly a gallon of milkshake in St Louis, Missouri.(n)

programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly.(n)

programme.desc: After opening a successful pizza restaurant, Anthony thought branching off with Trovato's Due would be a piece of cake. Now, he's drowning in debt and has called in Willie for help.(n)

programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, Adam Richman tries to eat a 9lb steak platter in less than 40 minutes in the Sleeping Cow challenge.(n)

programme.desc: At New York's Port Royal Pub and Grille, Adam Richman tackles the Davy Jones Locker Challenge, a huge platter of seafood that only one person has ever finished.(n)

programme.desc: In Oklahoma City, Adam Richman takes on a challenge in which he must eat 29 deep-fried catfish fillets.(n)

programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a goat's cheese salad and a sour cream and coffee cake.(n)

programme.desc: US chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a full meal for her LA friends, but tricks them into thinking they will get nothing more than thin soup and wilting greens.(n)

programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a supper and breakfast for her husband before she goes away for the night.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her middle children with a week of food and fun while the others are away, making cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup, chicken alfredo and grilled fruit pizzas.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's raids the pantry, and makes a fragrant chickpea curry with rice, then for sweet treats in a hurry, no-bake peanut butter bars save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's father-in-law, Chuck, is spearheading a big fence fixing project on the ranch, so Ree is saying thank you by delivering him and his crew a Tex-Mex lunch.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's cooks hearty breakfast biscuits that her husband and son are coming to collect on their way to feed the cattle.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: With his campaign slowly failing to revolutionise the diets of Rotherham residents, Jamie Oliver seeks advice from wartime cooking guru Marguerite Patton, who was once a part of the original Ministry of Food. He also witnesses the shocking measures the NHS has taken to deal with the country's obesity problem, and attempts to teach a recipe to 1,000 pupils in just one day.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: MI5 attempt to intercept a manuscript which could potentially leak vital information about the organisation. Nicholas Lyndhurst stars.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Drummond suspects Major Maxwell of being a spy for the KGB - leaving him no choice but to investigate. Nicholas Lyndhurst stars.(n)

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: The job centre's new manager embarks on a quest to find Frank a job suited to his talents, despite the staff's long experience of failure. Comedy, starring Michael Crawford, Michele Dotrice and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: As Barry tires of golf and looks for a new hobby, Billy's latest idea of an archery course is right on target. Long-running comedy series, starring Mike Grady, Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Invented Yorkshire Funny Stuff.
programme.desc: Howard is dismayed when Marina unwittingly buys him a life-like gorilla which attracts the attention of the local police. Meanwhile, a newspaper article prompts Truly, Clegg and Billy to try to track down Cyril Cooper - a man renowned for his green fingers and womanising ways. Comedy, starring Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Husband and the Showgirls.
programme.desc: Tom and Smiler arrange an interesting blind date and Truly discovers his ex-wife's new husband is coming to town. Frank Thornton and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright's day turns into a nightmare when Nurse Gladys Emmanuel has a problem with her washing machine. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel - but he cannot stop thinking about his business. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: Fig Biscuits and Inspirational Toilet Rolls.
programme.desc: Miser Arkwright decides to open the shop before dawn to catch the morning rush and fleece more unsuspecting customers. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is reluctant to prise open his wallet and buy a new suit, until Nurse Gladys Emmanuel gives him an incentive. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to expand his empire by opening a mobile shop in a bid to impress Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, but the enterprise is cut short by Granville's close encounter with some perishables. Comedy, with Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright is embarrassed after losing his trousers on the way to the wedding of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's niece. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright invents a saint's day as a pretext for checking the pockets of a foreign visitor suspected of shoplifting. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to improve the sale of an overstocked commodity with incredible efficiency, and Granville's lust for power leads to disaster. Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes gets the wrong end of the stick and fears her relatives are planning to send her to a nursing home. Furious, she sets out to persuade them she is not going senile - unaware it is actually Spartacus the dog who is set to be sent away. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Andy Parsons, Andrew Lawrence and Milton Jones.
programme.desc: An evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo. Andy Parsons is the man in charge, treating the audience to his own brand of humour, before introducing routines by fellow comedians Andrew Lawrence and Milton Jones, who share their light-hearted views on modern life.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The squalid students face a team of toffs on University Challenge. Guest starring Ben Elton, Hugh Laurie, Emma Thompson and Stephen Fry, and featuring a performance by Motorhead.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Drastic measures are called for when the students are broke and Vyvyan claims to be pregnant, so Neil is forced to join the police to support them.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Ever eager to distract herself, Fran learns to play the piano, while Bernard believes he has fallen in love. Sitcom, with Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, guest starring comedian Nina Conti.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: A heatwave causes unprecedented problems for the gang, as Fran suffers from insomnia, Bernard needs a girlfriend to stop him staring, and Manny worries about the reliability of his magic hot-water bottle. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, with Johnny Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Howard and Vince travel to the Arctic in an attempt to beat Dixon Bainbridge to the legendary egg of Mantumbi. The duo come face to face with ice demon Black Frost, and befriend a polar bear. Surreal comedy, starring Julian Barratt and Noel Fielding.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Dixon Bainbridge announces his intention to demolish the zoo to build a road, so Howard and Vince embark on a perilous journey into the Jungle Room to find the only man who can save them - missing adventurer Tommy Nookah. But first they have to get past a pack of wolves, which proves far more complicated than anticipated.(n)

programme.title: Garth Marenghi's Darkplace
programme.desc: Dr Rick Dagless finds himself on the tartan trail of a mist which kills unwary travellers, accompanied by the sound of phantom bagpipes. He must discover its sinister origins before it claims more victims.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry wins a competition - but when the prize proves more trouble than it is worth, it spells disaster for him and everyone who helps him try to get rid of it. Mike Grady stars.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: The presenter visits Masham Brewery, where he uses local ingredients to cook Black Sheep ale pie and Yorkshire pudding with ale sausages.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: A visit to a famous fish restaurant in Whitby to talk about local specialities is followed up by the chef cooking pan-fried halibut with peas, horseradish and crispy pancetta bacon.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a cost-saving Mexican chilli featuring the much under-rated shin of beef, reveals the secrets of his home-made chapatis with aubergine dhal and shares two ideas for using up leftover chicken from the Sunday roast. Plus, a frugal twist on a favourite pasta dish.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver proves that frozen fish can be just as good as fresh with his recipe for tikka curry, demonstrates a spin on the much-loved cheese and beans combo with smoky barbecue baked beans and sweet potatoes, and shows how to make hoi sin chicken wraps for just £1.69 a head. Plus, two midweek ideas to transform roast beef leftovers - a Moroccan-inspired tagine and a hot and spicy noodle soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates a fresh spin on a fast-food favourite, preparing a bucket of fried chicken with rainbow slaw, sweet sticky potato wedges and charred corn on the cob, and he makes enough to feed a family of four for less than £10. The chef also shares tips on getting crispy chicken skin without having to deep-fry, and rustles up spiced sausage bake, garlic bread and a meat-free roast, as well as two very different recipes for leftover salmon.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a thrifty curry using chicken drumsticks bought for half the price of breast, but full of flavour. He also makes a Mexican omelette with a guacamole-style slaw, a giant vegetable rosti with poached eggs and crispy Cajun fishcakes, and `snake in the hole', a cross between a roasted meatloaf and meatballs with Yorkshire pudding.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef samples Mediterranean food and visits his favourite places in the region. In the first programme he catches a ferry to the mountainous island of Corsica, where he tastes sausages and sheep's cheese, and discovers the locals have a passion for chestnuts.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef continues to explore his favourite locations in the Mediterranean, visiting a lagoon in Sardinia where he watches fishermen catching mullet using ancient Roman methods. He also boards a ferry heading for the city of Palermo in Sicily and discovers one of the most impressive pasta dishes of his career.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef experiences the bustling and colourful fish market in the Sicilian city of Catania and discovers dishes developed through centuries of poverty in Puglia on Italy's mainland. However, he is shocked to wake up one morning to find his vehicle is missing.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts his initiation into the rural Dorset community around River Cottage, recalling examples of warm hospitality enjoyed both at home and at more formal venues. He also gives hints on entertaining River Cottage-style.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall emphasises the need for smallholders to be wily entrepreneurs, always ready to barter and haggle, recalling the local farmers' market where he used to sell the excess of the year's harvest and had a run-in with a traffic warden.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts the steep learning curve he mastered in keeping poultry, from first acquiring hens to teaching them to climb his fox-proof coop, and his subsequent attempts to breed the tastiest roasting chicken in the country.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recalls his attempts at local crafts, from hedge-laying and charcoal-making to more bizarre pursuits such as mouse-charming and the Dorset sport of pumpkin-guddling. He also remembers his entry into a beach sculpture competition, which saw him cover himself in dead fish.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recalls the opportunities offered by the local rivers and sea, from fishing for tasty treats such as crabs, eels, cuttlefish and pike, to the chance of escaping his smallholding for a waterside adventure. He also reveals the practicalities and benefits of making seaweed fertiliser.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall recounts how he revelled in his Dorset surroundings and learned to feed himself using wildlife in the area. He reveals how wild food became a staple in his diet when he discovered the thrill of hunting rabbits, pigeons and roe deer.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall considers his future at River Cottage. He looks back to his early days of pasture management and caring for animals, and examines the true test of any smallholder's mettle - the slaughter.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.sub-title: The View from River Cottage: Growing Your Own.
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall looks back at his time in Dorset, which began modestly and developed into a major quest for self-sufficiency. He offers tips on the six main ingredients for leading the simple life, beginning by stressing the importance of fresh-killed meat and home-grown fruit and vegetables.(n)
