Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Payne is the taunting psycho threatening LA with high explosives, Jack the agent who's close to catching him. When Payne loads a bus with bombs, Jack must evacuate the passengers while keeping the vehicle travelling at over 50mph. Thriller(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 3. Part 3 of 4. Jimmy co-founds Interscope Records and cuts a deal with Death Row Records to become the label's distributor. But hostility mounts across America at the violence in rap music. Jimmy, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur become embroiled in a violent feud with East Coast rap rivals, including Sean "Puffy" Combs and his Bad Boy Records(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 4. Part 4 of 4. Dre produces Eminem's "The Slim Shady LP" that takes the rap music world by storm. Later, Dre and Jimmy create Beats Electronics and make a historic 2014 deal with Apple(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky (Shia LaBeouf) and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes (Megan Fox) are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is the main impediment to them gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Power to the President. Isobel Yeung reports from Turkey as citizens head to the polls in a nationwide referendum that grants President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan unprecedented power(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. Tim Meadows, Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, and Imogen Poots co-star. Samberg, Taccone, and Schaffer co-wrote the screenplay, while Taccone and Schaffer shared directing duties(n)

programme.title: Indignation
programme.desc: A young Jewish atheist attends college in 1951 Ohio, where he clashes with the school's established social order and his overbearing parents' hopes for his future. At the same time, he falls for an attractive, complicated classmate named Olivia(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: Petrolhead Speed lives to race, but will big business get in his way?(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: In a parallel universe, young Lyra Belacqua journeys to the far North to save her best friend and other kidnapped children from terrible experiments by a mysterious organization(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: 40-Year-Old Virgin star Steve Carell steps into the telephonic shoes of television's most beloved bumbling detective in this big-screen adaptation of the hit 1960s-era comedy series created by Mel Brooks. The evil geniuses at KAOS have hatched a diabolical plot to dominate every living man, woman, and child on the planet, and their plot gets under way as they attack the headquarters of the U.S. spy agency Control. As a result of the attack, the identity of every agent working for Control has been compromised. Realizing that the only way to thwart KAOS' evil plan is to promote eager but inexperienced Control analyst Maxwell Smart (Carell) to the rank of special agent, the Chief (Alan Arkin) reluctantly teams Smart with Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway) -- a veteran super-spy whose beauty is only surpassed by her lethality. With no real field experience to speak of and nothing but sheer enthusiasm and a handful of fancy spy gadgets to help him accomplish his deadly mission, Maxwell Smart his new partner, Agent 99, will be forced to faces malevolent KAOS head Siegfried (Terence Stamp) and his loyal army of minions in a decisive fight that will determine the fate of the free world. Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, David Koechner, Terry Crews, and Ken Davitian co-star(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Red Woman. In the Season 6 premiere, Sansa and Theon are on the run from Winterfell and Bolton's soldiers; Jaime delivers bad news to Cersei on his return from Dorne; Davos sends for help from the Wall; and Daenerys explains her identity to Khal Moro as Daario and Jorah continue their search for her, while Tyrion and Varys wander the eerily empty streets of Meereen(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Home. Bran continues to train under the guidance of the Three-Eyed Raven, who warns him not to dwell too much on the past. Meanwhile, Tyrion must get creative to find encouraging news as the situation in Meereen grows more dire every day; Tommen gets advice from Jaime; Balon Greyjoy hears several proposals; Davos finally gets help from outside Castle Black; and Ramsay comes up with a new plan of self-preservation(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Oathbreaker. Bran glimpses a pivotal battle from his father's past; Daenerys learns what's in store for her at Vaes Dothrak; the High Sparrow discusses the importance of faith with Tommen; Arya crosses a threshold in her training to be No One; Varys comes up with a solution to a vexing problem; Ramsay gets a gift and news from the North(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Book of the Stranger. A disillusioned Jon is resolved to leave Castle Black, but a surprise reunion could give him a noble and urgent purpose following his reincarnation. Meanwhile, Tyrion pursues a deal with the masters of Slaver's Bay as he stalls for Daenerys' return; Theon tries to make amends for the past; Jorah and Daario realize the difficulty of their next move; and Cersei discusses Margaery's future with Olenna(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Door. Sansa confronts Littlefinger about what he knew of Ramsay's intentions; Arya gets an opportunity to prove herself; Bran is transported to a dangerous place; Tyrion envisions an unusual alliance; Brienne undertakes an important new mission(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Blood of My Blood. Gilly meets the Tarlys, but it's clear that Sam's ill-tempered father has no interest in reconciling with his long lost son or believing any of the good things he's done. Meanwhile, Arya mulls a difficult decision backstage; Jaime confronts the High Sparrow; and Bran encounters a familiar face just in the nick of time(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Broken Man. Jaime assumes control of the seige at Riverrun, but finds its occupants ready, willing and able to wait it out. Meanwhile, the High Sparrow becomes fixated on another prey in King's Landing; Arya hatches a plan to get out of Braavos; Yara and Theon plot their next move; and Olenna and Cersei discuss their families' futures(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: No One. Brienne confronts Jaime during the siege at Riverrun; Cersei delivers a defiant response; Tyrion's plan starts to come together; Arya is presented with a new challenge(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.desc: The pot-smoking friends are suspected of being terrorists(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: Director: Peter Chelsom. A couple reunite years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: A college dropout gets a job as a broker for a suburban investment firm, which puts him on the fast track to success, but the job might not be as legitimate as it sounds(n)

programme.title: The Strange History of Don't Ask, Don't Tell
programme.desc: A look at the U.S. armed forces' ban on gays and lesbians includes remarks from activists, politicians, and active and former service members; and a timeline of the contentious process leading up to the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell, which takes effect on Sept. 20, 2011, and allows homosexuals to serve openly for the first time. Directed by Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his friend decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various hit movies(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Bridget is emotionally satisfied at long last with Mark Darcy, her barrister boyfriend. But complicating issues is the re-entrance of her ex-lover, Daniel Cleaver, whom Jones, perhaps mistakenly, thought she had finally gotten over(n)

programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.desc: Spring break gets totally wild when thirtysomething friends Gayle (Amy Poehler), Becky (Parker Posey) and Judi (Rachel Dratch) go vacationing at a popular resort frequented by college coeds in order to prevent a politician's daughter from embarrassing her family(n)

programme.desc: A trio of fuzzy and amusing aliens crash land in Valerie's pool, putting a decided dampener on her future wedding plans to cheating Dr Ted Gallagher(n)

programme.title: Protocol
programme.desc: A bubbly cocktail waitress goes to Washington and stirs up the US State Department(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A witty script and a great ensemble cast add up to one of Woody Allen's most hilarious farces. Allen wrote, directed and stars as a washed-up filmmaker who is suddenly stricken with psychosomatic blindness on the eve of his big comeback(n)

programme.desc: Big-screen animated adventures of the cartoon characters from the TV series. Homer triggers an environmental calamity in Springfield that has far-reaching effects for the town and the planet(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three female friends inadvertently bring the devil to their sleepy New England town. He proceeds to seduce each of them, and the trio must work together again to stop him from his plans for total domination(n)

programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky (Shia LaBeouf) and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes (Megan Fox) are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is the main impediment to them gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Huntsman: Winter's War'

The film stars Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron and Emily Blunt, and is directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Dr. Dolittle 3
programme.desc: A young woman discovers that her father's special talent runs in the family in this direct-to-video sequel to the 1998 blockbuster (which, unlike the previous two films in the series, does not feature Eddie Murphy). Maya Dolittle (Kyla Pratt), the youngest daughter of veterinarian John Dolittle, makes the surprising discovery that, like her dad, she can understand what animals have to say, and speak with them in their own language. Unlike her father, Maya hasn't found a suitable use for her talents, and as she finds an outlet for her unique language skills, she is sent away to Durango, a combination summer camp and dude ranch, where she strikes up a rapport with both the fellow campers and the livestock. When she learns that Durango is on the verge of going out of business due to money problems, Maya starts working with the camp's horses and cattle, giving them a much needed pep talk as they're entered in a local rodeo that could save Durango. Dr. Dolittle 3: The Daughter Is In also features Kristen Wilson, John Amos, and Walker Howard(n)

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs
programme.desc: Adapted from author Lois Duncan's 1971 children's book of the same name, director Thor Freudenthal's Hotel for Dogs follows two mischievous orphans as they attempt to hide dozens of stray dogs in an abandoned hotel. Disheartened by their new guardians' announcement that pets are strictly forbidden, 16-year-old Andi (Emma Roberts) and her younger brother, Bruce (Jake T. Austin), race to find a home for their loyal dog Friday. Fortunately for Friday, there's an abandoned hotel just around the corner, and Bruce possesses just the kind of mechanical smarts needed to transform the rundown inn into a four-star retreat for canines. For a while, Friday and his friends have it made, but when the neighbors start to get suspicious, Andi and Bruce resort to every trick in the book in order to prevent their secret from being discovered. Don Cheadle, Emma Roberts, and Lisa Kudrow star in a family-friendly film penned by screenwriter Jeff Lowell(n)

programme.title: Jonas Brothers: The Concert Experience
programme.desc: The Jonas Brothers burn up the big screen in this 3-D rockumentary chronicling their "Burning Up" concert tour. The film features exclusive behind-the-scenes footage, a brand-new song, and special guest performances by Taylor Swift and Demi Lovato. Directed by Bruce Hendricks ("Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert")(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Wonderfully rewarding urban fairy tale about a 12-year-old prodigy (the marvelous Freddie Highmore) who heads to New York City to find and reunite with the musician parents who abandoned him as a baby. Keri Russell and Jonathan Rhys Meyers costar as the young lovebirds who made sweet music (and a child) before their romance was dramatically and untimely cut short. Directed by Kirsten Sheridan. Robin Williams is a gas as a modern-day Fagin trying to "help" the lad in his quest(n)

But when she falls for Ian Miller (John Corbett), who's definitely not Greek, her family are in uproar. But Toula is determined to find happiness. Edited for language(n)

Brian Helgeland's historical sports drama/biopic 42 relates the historic 1947 baseball season in which Brooklyn Dodgers general manager Branch Rickey (Harrison Ford) decides to sign the first black Major League player, Jackie Robinson (Chadwick Boseman). Although Robinson faces ugly, vicious racism from other clubs, fans, and on occasion his own teammates, Rickey encourages him to not fight back. By following that advice, Robinson allows his remarkable athletic talent to speak for itself, and soon the first-year player becomes one the most popular players on the team, eventually securing the Rookie of the Year award. Christopher Meloni and Hamish Linklater co-star(n)

programme.title: Sister Act

Although she's not a natural nun, she soon befriends the sisters, takes them out on the town and teaches them to sing, soul-style. Lots of fun, most stemming from the big-hearted Goldberg(n)

programme.desc: Batman and Superman clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Sophie (Amanda Seyfried) has one wish for her wedding day: to have her father walk her down the aisle. Now she just has to figure out who he is. Meryl Streep, Julie Waters, Christine Baranski, Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth and Stellan Skarsgard round up the stellar cast of this irresistibly charming musical adventure that celebrates mothers, daughters, fathers and true love to the rhythm of some uniquely catchy tunes. Based on the Broadway smash-hit and filled with the ABBA songs you know and love, the film will make you dance, jive and have the time of your life(n)
A rag doll battles a mechanical cat beast in the post-apocalyptic future(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: New York lawyer Vinny has never won a case. When his cousin is accused of murder in a backwater Alabama town, it's up to the nervous Vinny to save him from jail(n)

programme.title: The Children
programme.desc: A New Year's gathering in the British countryside turns terrifying when the children become infected with a virus that causes them to attack the adults in a fit of homicidal rage(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: A single father who has just found success as the host of an outrageous television talk show begins to question his path in life when he returns home to attend his parents' 50th wedding anniversary party in the company of his famous fiancée -- a reality television star -- in this crisis-of-conscience comedy starring Martin Lawrence. RJ Stevens (Lawrence) is a television talk-show sensation who has transcended his modest Southern beginnings to become the most popular self-help guru ever to grace the small screen. His show, "Team of Me," is a ratings juggernaut, his fiancée is a beautiful reality television star, and his pockets are always lined with large bills. There are few Tinseltown dreams that RJ hasn't already achieved, so when his parents announce their 50th wedding anniversary, the family-oriented television star immediately drops everything and sets his sights on Georgia. As a boy, RJ was always the target of ridicule within his family, but these days things are different; not only does RJ have a ten-year-old son, but his bride-to-be is admired by countless viewers all across the globe on a weekly basis. But RJ's egotistical West Coast attitude simply doesn't fly in the South, and when his lovable but relentless family refuses to cut him any slack due to his current superstar status, he must finally pause and take stock of the man he has become. Louis C.K., Cedric the Entertainer, Michael Clarke Duncan, and James Earl Jones co-star in a Southern-flavored family comedy written and directed by Malcolm D. Lee(n)

programme.title: The Order
programme.desc: Brian Helgeland's religious thriller stars Heath Ledger as Alex Bernier, a young Catholic priest who adheres to a rare form of the faith. When he learns of the strange death of his mentor, he travels to Rome with his fellow priest Thomas Garrett and savant Mara Sinclair - a woman who once tried to kill him during an exorcism - to investigate the mystery. Brian Helgeland's religious thriller stars Heath Ledger as Alex Bernier, a young Catholic priest who adheres to a rare form of the faith. When he learns of the strange death of his mentor, he travels to Rome with his fellow priest Thomas Garrett and savant Mara Sinclair - a woman who once tried to kill him during an exorcism - to investigate the mystery. What he finds is the truth behind the myth of the Sin Eater, an immortal figure who takes on the sins of the damned to ensure their passage into Heaven. But with immortality comes both spiritual and temporal corruption, as Bernier battles both the church and demons to uncover the secrets of the Sin Eater. The film reunited the director with the stars of his film A Knight's Tale and also stars Benno Fürmann and Peter Weller(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: In this sequel to Friday, Ice Cube returns as the streetwise LA dude who grassed up a local gangster. Who's now out and on his trail. This would be a good time to chill out in the suburbs with cousin Mike Epps and uncle Don 'Dc' Curry, who happens to have won the lottery but, as he finds out, money can't buy you love or security in Steve Carr's smart comedy(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this hysterical big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos a young woman and brings her to his mansion atop a clay mountain. There, she learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets as she fights for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.desc: This exhilarating spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.desc: Sam Mendes's critically acclaimed drama with Tom Hanks, Paul Newman, Jude Law and Daniel Craig with a mob enforcer and his son seeing familial revenge(n)

programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. The story of a cop, a crook, and a beautiful friendship gone sour takes place in a world where loyalty goes to the highest bidder and the only one you can trust turns out to be your worst enemy. Once partners in crime, Archie Moses and Rock Keats are now on opposite sides of the law. Each feels betrayed by the other, but as fate would have it they're back together and on the run(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Teenage fraudster Frank Abagnale Jr takes on various identities in order to cash fake cheques worth over $2.5m. But his outlandish scheme soon catches the eye of the FBI. Crime(n)

programme.desc: The aristocratic daughter of Lord Croft takes on her old man's archaeological mantle, battling the Illuminati, a sinister crew bent on discovering an ancient relic which will enable them to control time. Hi-tech adventure with a leading lady who's at the top of her game(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: Batman and Robin try to stop Mr. Freeze and Poison Ivy from spreading a deadly frost over Gotham City(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: An Egyptian-born doctor is arrested on his way back to his US home after a terrorist attack. His American wife campaigns for information on his whereabouts(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Payne is the taunting psycho threatening LA with high explosives, Jack the agent who's close to catching him. When Payne loads a bus with bombs, Jack must evacuate the passengers while keeping the vehicle travelling at over 50mph. Thriller(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Suspecting their new house may be haunted, a distressed couple call in a pair of top paranormal experts to investigate. Horror(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: Wes Craven's Scream (1996) was a half-parody/half-tribute to the first wave of slasher films of the 1970s and 1980s, and since most of them spawned a large number of sequels, it's only appropriate that Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson produced a third installment of their Scream franchise. Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell), traumatized by the brutal murders of her friends, has left her hometown of Woodsboro and is working in California as a crisis intervention counselor. Meanwhile, "Stab," the novel by Gale Weathers (Courtney Cox Arquette), is spawning a series of successful horror films, and as Stab 3: Return to Woodsboro is being filmed in Los Angeles, a lunatic has gotten his hands on a copy of the script, and is murdering the characters in the same order that they die in the movie. But predicting who will die next is not as simple as it might seem, since the producers have circulated three different screenplays, with different endings. In addition to Campbell and Cox-Arquette, David Arquette returns from the first two films as less-than-bright "Dewey" Riley; new members of the cast include Parker Posey, Patrick Dempsey, Scott Foley, and Jenny McCarthy. Kevin Williamson wrote the original story, but the screenplay was penned by Ehren Kruger(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The aristocratic daughter of Lord Croft takes on her old man's archaeological mantle, battling the Illuminati, a sinister crew bent on discovering an ancient relic which will enable them to control time. Hi-tech adventure with a leading lady who's at the top of her game(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: M Night Shyamalan's end-of-the-world thriller begins in New York City with an outbreak of inexplicable suicides, which rapidly starts to take on plague proportions. As the wave of self-destruction spreads, people naturally enough do their best to escape whatever it is that's causing it. Among them are Philadelphia science teacher Elliot Moore and his wife Alma, along with Mark's friend Julian and his daughter Jess. Their initial plans to flee to the state capital don't work out, so they take off to the countryside, where they think they'll be safe. But it's not long before they discover that they may have made a bad choice..(n)

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: Powerful, Oscar-winning biopic of Ron Kovic, a patriotic all-American boy who returned from the war in Vietnam with terrible injuries and became a committed anti-war campaigner. The teenage Kovic is raring to fight for his country, but his battle injuries earn him a horrific spell in an ill-equipped hospital, and he returns home - in a wheelchair - a changed man. Kovic co-wrote the screenplay with Oliver Stone(n)

programme.title: Tashi and the Monk
programme.desc: A visit to a home for orphans and abandoned children in northeastern India that was founded by a former Buddhist monk, who's reminded of his own troubled childhood by an unruly new arrival(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: The strait-laced nephew of Sgt Joe Friday and his easy-going partner in the Los Angeles Police Department try to bust a criminal conspiracy between a pornographer and an evangelist(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: After the highly acclaimed independent film Bottle Rocket, director Wes Anderson followed up with a quirky Touchstone Studios film entitled Rushmore. Written by Anderson and friend Owen Wilson (an actor in Armageddon and Anaconda), they created the story of Max Fischer, a highly eccentric 15-year-old boy who attends the tenth grade at Rushmore Academy. Played by Jason Schwartzman (Talia Shire's son and Francis Ford Coppola's nephew), Max is a poor student with big dreams and a love of extracurricular activities. Max is editor of the school newspaper and yearbook, president of the chess, astronomy, French, and German clubs, captain of the fencing team, and director of the school play. Max is also a compulsive liar, telling everyone that his barber father (Seymour Cassel) is really a brain surgeon. Suddenly Max falls in love with Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a first-grade teacher at the school. He also makes a new friend in business tycoon Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), an eccentric millionaire who also loves Miss Cross. The love triangle heats up as Max refuses to believe that his age has anything to do with Miss Cross refusing his romantic advances. Also Max's scheme to erect an aquarium on the school baseball diamond gets him booted out of Rushmore Academy. As his life crumbles around him, he is forced to grow up and accept the consequences of his actions and his lies. He throws himself more into his extracurricular activities, hoping to redeem himself by staging the most ambitious school play ever attempted(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house(n)

programme.title: The Limey
programme.desc: Terence Stamp stars in this this tense thriller as a hardened criminal whose release from jail prompts him to look for his daughter's murderer. He contacts her much-older boyfriend (Peter Fonda), and discovers the man has a few skeletons in his closet. Lesley Ann Warren, Luis Guzman, Barry Newman. Steven Soderbergh directed(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this cryptic sci-fi adventure, Roy rescues his son Alton from a religious cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper, the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama, a remake of George Cukor's 1939 satire, from writer-director Diane English. Mary Haines thinks she has it all - a happy marriage, a lovely daughter, a top clothes designer job at her father's firm and a solid circle of very good friends. But then she hears through the grapevine that her husband is having an affair with a perfume saleswoman and, with that one thread unpicked, her entire world begins to unravel… Also starring Debra Messing, Jada Pinkett Smith, Candice Bergen, Cloris Leachman, Bette Midler and Carrie Fisher(n)

Then FBI agent Vince Vaughn asks for her help - serial killer Vincent D'Onofrio is in custody but in a coma and unless she can unlock the secrets of his mind, an imprisoned girl will be his next victim in hours. programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. programme.title: House of Wax
programme.desc: A bunch of college students are stranded in a small town where suffering for art takes on a whole new meaning in this tale of terror. Carly (Elisha Cuthbert) and her boyfriend, Wade (Jared Padalecki), have hit the road with a handful of their friends to attend a championship college football game; tagging along with them are Carly's bratty friend Paige (Paris Hilton, Carly's trouble-making twin brother Nick (Chad Michael Murray), and Blake (Robert Ri'chard), Paige's latest boy toy. While camping out for the night, the gang makes the mistake of getting on the wrong side of a mysterious local redneck, and the next morning they discover that Wade's car no longer works. As the others continue on to the big game, Carly and Wade make their way into the closest town, Ambrose, and discover it's all but deserted, except for a local tourist attraction, the House of Wax. However, it isn't long before they find out why the wax sculptures at the museum look so freakishly real, and discover a pair of murderous brothers are keen on making them part of the next exhibit. House of Wax is an in-name-only remake of the well-remembered 1953 3-D horror outing starring Vincent Price, which was in turn based on the 1933 picture Mystery of the Wax Museum(n)

programme.title: The Loch

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The heads of an Ivy League private college tempt fate by inviting Jessica to lecture to their pupils, and it is not long before the sleuth has a murder to investigate. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: While Jessica is enjoying her stay at a fishing lodge in Ireland, she finds out the owner is being harassed by a consortium wanting to buy his land for a strip mine. Whodunit, guest starring Rod Taylor and Martin Jarvis, with Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Stranger at the Gates - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. A handsome man from Denmark arrives at the household in search of work, setting Mariette's heart racing with his dashing good looks, but Charley is not impressed by the visitor's charms. Drama, starring David Jason, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Philip Franks.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Holmes disguises himself as a plumber to gain access to the home of a blackmailing art dealer who targets members of high society. Robert Hardy guest stars in a feature-length episode of the period drama, with Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke.(n)

programme.title: Goodbye Mr Chips
programme.desc: Martin Clunes stars as an earnest Latin master working at the Brookfield School of the 1880s, where he meets and marries his true love Kathie and finds himself touched by politics, grief and the utter devastation of World War One. Charting more than 50 years of one man's extraordinary life, the story ends in the 1930s, as a wise, elderly and much-loved Mr Chipping lives out his last days in retirement. Frank Delaney's adaptation of James Hilton's timeless classic, which has never been out of print since first appearing as a magazine serialisation in 1934, and for which Robert Donat whipped an Oscar from under the nose of Gone with the Wind's Clark Gable in the 1939 film production. Also starring Victoria Hamilton, Conleth Hill and Patrick Malahide.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: When a woman is found strangled, a pathologist detects chilling similarities with a number of unsolved murders - prompting Wycliffe and his team to reopen 11-year-old case files. Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Tim Wylton and Helen Masters.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Steven Mullan is found beaten and drowned in his bath. Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star, with guest appearances by Jenny Seagrove and Julian Wadham.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Millionaire's wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the woman's husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearing's outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The glamorous Ruth Van Rydock contacts her old friend Jane Marple with a mystery - her sister Carrie Louise's study has been devastated by a suspicious fire. While Carrie Louise has the same cheerful outlook as ever, Ruth fears dark forces are at play at Stonygates, the home Carrie shares with her third husband, various relatives and a motley crew of young criminals, the latest subject of Carrie's philanthropic endeavours. But on the evening before a theatrical show is staged for their guests, one of whom is Miss Marple, an even more fascinating performance takes place before their very eyes - one where the final act is murder. Julia McKenzie stars, with guest appearances from Joan Collins, Penelope Wilton, Brian Cox, Maxine Peake, Alexei Sayle, Sarah Smart, Ian Ogilvy, Sean Hughes and Nigel Terry.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A local woman is killed when an experiment in biological warfare goes tragically wrong. Sam also falls victim to a potentially fatal illness as a result of the project. Foyle is forced to head into the most secretive and dangerous areas of wartime research, unearthing secrets that cannot be revealed even to the prime minister. Michael Kitchen stars, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Philip Franks.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A blood-spattered hotel room and a stolen credit card lead Ronnie and Joe to Charles Hutton, a member of the wealthy upper classes who dotes on his wife Camille and daughter Georgia. The detectives find clues that suggest Georgia gave birth at the scene, but where is the baby now? The young woman and her boyfriend Rufus prove difficult for Jake and Kate to prosecute, and to make matters worse, the defence counsel turns out to be Jake's old nemesis. As the evidence stacks up, how far will Charles go to protect his privileged family? Guest starring James Wilby and Joseph Millson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When a series of shootings claims one of their own, Ronnie and Joe have little time to grieve - they must solve the case before the killer reaches their next target on a hit list that includes CPS director Henry Sharpe. It gradually becomes apparent that the common thread connecting all the names is the case of Mark Glendon, convicted of the murder of his wife four years earlier. Although he's still in custody, a retrial is imminent, putting pressure on the team to catch the murderer before the jury delivers its verdict.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Still reeling from the death of one of their own, Ronnie and Joe face a new challenge when an innocent young mum is fatally stabbed in a busy marketplace, just as a senior police officer publicly pledges to crack down on knife crime. Under pressure from all sides, the pair struggle to gather evidence against the youth they think is responsible, and the suspect's unintentional confession appears to bring the case to a close. However, Ronnie is the only person who hears the admission, and it proves difficult getting anyone to believe him. With the detective's honesty cast into doubt and his effectiveness questioned at every turn, is this the end of his career? With Tony Gardner, Sharon Small and Colin Salmon. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: The evacuation of a central London hospital leads to the discovery of a tragic death. programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads to Thailand to find out about the surprising that makes a prawn cracker unique, while Matt Tebbutt visits Britain's largest producer of fresh herbs to learn about a new hi-tech method of extending shelf-life. Kate Quilton investigates what actually goes into sodium-replacement salts and examines whether salt really deserves its unhealthy reputation.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Craft mason and mountain rescuer Pete Roe is called out to try and find a puppy that has fallen down a 50-foot sinkhole near Wensleydale.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Debra Mann from Reading, Berkshire, has fallen in love with the Bay of the Somme in the north of France, and has set heart on a holiday getaway where she and her sister can spend time with family and friends. Scarlette Douglas shows them both a selection of properties for a £64,000 budget - with plenty of surprises along the way.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Wiltshire couple Martin and Michelle MacClay want a holiday home in France's Loire Valley, so Scarlette Douglas helps find them the perfect property on a budget of £73,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Gary Fitzpatrick and Shahine Korimbocus want a holiday home in the tranquil Limousin area of France where they can enjoy an outdoor lifestyle with their 20-month-old twins Charlie and Catherine, and Gary's son Dominic. Brought up with French culture in Mauritius, Shahine wants the children to share her enjoyment of it, and to pick up the language. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Francophiles Madeline and Andy Morton from Portsmouth are looking for a holiday home they can fly or drive to in the rural landscapes of the Charente region in west-central France. With cash savings of £45,000, they're hoping for a traditional two-bedroom home with charm and character. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, hoping that one will be their dream house.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist and female impersonator Marcus Hunter-Neill hopes to impress with a red carpet-themed evening as he hosts the first party in Belfast. However, his alter ego Lady Portia Diamante steals the limelight as he competes for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jamaican lifeguard Lenny Irving serves up Caribbean cuisine at the second of the week's dinner parties in Belfast. He also hopes to win over his guests by complementing his menu with strong rum - and seems particularly keen to impress Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Freelance feminist writer Cat Anderson hosts the third dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to win over her guests with her bohemian chic style and live music. However, her efforts are wasted on lifeguard Lenny Irving, who is only interested in Fiona Rush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner-party challenge from Belfast is hosted by charity worker and confident cook Rosie Smyth. She decides the best way to win over her guests is to have a `come-as-your-teenage-self' evening, and a zingy mojito cheesecake.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush hosts the final dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to impress with a nautical-themed evening. However, one of her guests is unimpressed with the amount of fish on the menu, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Old Times Guesthouse in Ipswich, Suffolk, where mother-and-daughter duo Linda and Kelly Langdown hope a go-karting session will get the contest off to a flying start. However, a lack of breakfast options and corner-cutting on the guests' orders do not go down very well.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit the Flower Pot in Sunbury-on-Thames on their second night, where owner Simon Bailey and French manager Pierre Cudon provide stylish continental-inspired accommodation, but the hosts are left puzzled by some of the feedback they receive the next morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the family-run Dolphin Hotel in Exmouth, Devon, which has been a life's work for hotelier Jo Knowles. On arrival, Pat and Nigel find a suspicious stain, before the guests put on their war faces for a game of paintball. Jo takes everyone to a floating restaurant for dinner, and the next morning she presents a huge spread for breakfast - but her diners are suspicious that it has been laid on specially for the competition.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants stay at the Mariners Beachside B&B in Seaton, Devon, but are disappointed by the cleanliness of the property. They take part in a town-crying competition during the afternoon, and host Nigel feels under pressure to deliver his award-winning breakfast the next morning. Come feedback time, the owners discover not all their guests share the same opinion.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to find out what they have been paid, and confront their rivals. Simon Bailey and Pierre Cudon from the Flower Pot feel the feedback left by Nigel and Pat Booth is a step too far, while the Mariners B&B owners hit back at the men's opinion of their establishment's cleanliness. Linda and Kelly Langdown of the Old Times Guest House question the rating of their facilities, while the Dolphin Hotel's Jo Knowles has a confession to make regarding her hosting.(n)

programme.title: The Queen's Mother-in-Law
programme.desc: The story of Prince Philip's mother Princess Alice, a great-granddaughter of Queen Victoria who married into the Greek royal family, but was forced into exile when revolutionaries overthrew the monarchy. She then suffered a severe nervous breakdown, which led to spells in mental hospitals and experimental treatment from psychiatrists including Sigmund Freud. The trauma had a shattering effect on her marriage and led to a fractured childhood for her only son. However, she eventually won her battle with mental illness and became an unlikely hero during the Second World War, risking her life to hide a Jewish family from the Nazis, before dedicating the rest of her life to working with the poor in Greece.(n)

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas returns to narrate another light-hearted retrospective poking fun at Britain's viewing habits in the 1970s. This time, he focuses on the world of comedy, unfettered as it was to the conventions of political correctness. A selection of clips from hit TV shows illustrate how, if viewers were not straight, white, middle-class men, they were at risk of being offended, and highlights examples from On the Buses, The Two Ronnies, Dave Allen at Large and The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club. Includes commentary and contributions by Melvyn Hayes, Eric Chappell, Bill Oddie, Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Grace Dent, Nish Kumar, Ellie Taylor, Joel Dommett and Phil Wang.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from the 1970s, focusing on the comedies, documentaries and public information films that made people so anxious 40 years ago. Some of the famous shows covered include Man Alive and Brass Tacks, as well as The Goodies taking on the police and June Whitfield burning her bra. The show features first-hand accounts from the people who were making telly at the time, including Barry Cryer, Janet Street-Porter and Bill Oddie.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with David Mitchell and Cariad Lloyd, taking on Jon Richardson and Russell Howard. Sam Simmons joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: Are You Right There, Father Ted?.
programme.desc: The priest offends Craggy Island's Chinese community and pulls out all the stops to convince them that he is not racist - but his efforts end in disaster. Sitcom, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly and Pauline McLynn, with Ozzie Yue.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas returns to narrate another light-hearted retrospective poking fun at Britain's viewing habits in the 1970s. This time, he focuses on the world of comedy, unfettered as it was to the conventions of political correctness. A selection of clips from hit TV shows illustrate how, if viewers were not straight, white, middle-class men, they were at risk of being offended, and highlights examples from On the Buses, The Two Ronnies, Dave Allen at Large and The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club. Includes commentary and contributions by Melvyn Hayes, Eric Chappell, Bill Oddie, Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Grace Dent, Nish Kumar, Ellie Taylor, Joel Dommett and Phil Wang.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from the 1970s, focusing on the comedies, documentaries and public information films that made people so anxious 40 years ago. Some of the famous shows covered include Man Alive and Brass Tacks, as well as The Goodies taking on the police and June Whitfield burning her bra. The show features first-hand accounts from the people who were making telly at the time, including Barry Cryer, Janet Street-Porter and Bill Oddie.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of first-time buyers who could not be more different. Newlyweds Carl and Liz left their London lifestyle behind to look for a marital home in picturesque St Albans. Basketballing best buddies Jamie and Mike pooled their resources to buy in London's East End. But finding a home for the tall twosome was never going to be easy for Kirstie Allsopp. As well as looking back at their original search, the programme reveals how they have got on since.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp revisits Nadine and Toby, who bought and renovated their first home at the age of 26 and were in south-east London looking for their next big project. She also catches up with Wendy and Simon, who Phil Spencer helped to find a home in Derby, somewhere they could achieve the perfect work-life balance.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers who are struggling to find homes. In Southampton, Jenny and Tom are keen to move out of their cramped rental property and into a house of their own, but they are facing fierce competition and a fast market. Meanwhile, in the New Forest, Georgie and Will are desperate to live together after seven years of being a couple. However, with Will working in Belgium during the week, the pair are finding suitable properties are snapped up before they have even had the chance to view them.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Training guru Steve Carlyle hosts the first party in York, but a sophisticated evening, complete with a butler, does nothing to boost his reputation as he competes to win the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trevor Rooney, who leads tours of supposedly haunted sites in York, hosts the second dinner party in the city at a bric-a-brac warehouse. He also has several spooky surprises in store for his guests, including a magic show, a paranormal-themed menu and a ventriloquist's doll that spends the evening flirting with the female diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in York is hosted by Annie Albericci, who hopes to bring peace, love and harmony to the table with her festival-chic-themed evening. However, things go from bad to worse for Annie when the male guests find a racy photo of her.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Yvonne McGill hosts the fourth dinner challenge in York and goes for a 1960s-themed party, including a game of Snog, Marry, Avoid? and a Beatles tribute band. Meanwhile, guest Steve reveals his celebrity crush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Rebecca Ryan hosts the final dinner party in York, and hopes to impress her guests by throwing a Hollywood-themed evening of glitz and glamour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Borgue Hotel in Dumfries and Galloway, which owners Vince and Shirley Barrett run with military precision. On arrival, guests Adam and Naomi are not impressed with the decor, while Ken and Elaine do not like the orange towels. Later, over dinner, the hosts reveal who wears the trousers in their relationship, before Ken's jokes go down like a lead balloon.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Allscott Mill B&B in Telford, Shropshire, on their second night, where hosts Ken and Elaine Purchase welcome their guests. On arrival, Shirely and Vince find fault with the lack of headroom in their lodgings, while Adam and Naomi are bemused by the absence of a toilet brush in their bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Park House in Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where owners Ian and Joan Barr hope their colourful B&B will impress their guests. Adam and Naomi are wowed by the vibrant decor, but Ken and Elaine take issue with a dirty toilet brush.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Naomi and Adam Black welcome the contestants to East Thorne yurt retreat in Bude, Cornwall. They are pleased to discover it is Vince and Shirley's dream location, but Ken and Elaine don't share the same opinion. Later, the guests take part in an archery competition, and in the morning, are unimpressed with the DIY breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival owners meet for the final time on the last day of the competition to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Hosting skills, breakfasts, facilities and two toilet brush gripes are aired before the cash is counted and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre enthusiast Jay Coleman hosts the first party in Newport, Gwent, putting on a dramatic evening with an international menu, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peace activist Pippa Bartolotti hosts the second of the week's dinner parties in Newport, Gwent, serving up a menu of locally sourced vegetarian food and hoping to entertain her guests by indulging in a spot of fortune-telling. However, a talkative Duncan Powell threatens to dominate proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Radio journalist Emma Jones hosts the third dinner party in Newport, Gwent, serving up an American-themed menu of crab cakes and pulled pork, and the 23-year-old tries to boost her chances of taking home the prize money with a cheerleading session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Sarah Kinnear hosts the fourth dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and her guests are encouraged to attend wearing `Welsh icon' attire. However, she takes a gamble when she engages in a lively dinner-table debate with Duncan and Pippa.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment boss Duncan Powell hosts the final dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and hopes his Hawaiian-themed evening will impress his guests enough to win the prize. Unfortunately for him, prawn brains and sea bass bones harm his chances of success, so the confident cook tries to rescue the evening with a lemon posset.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the behaviour of the animals at Chester Zoo. An outbreak of disease in the penguin colony leaves chick Munch fighting for his life. Sulawesi macaque Lisa gives birth and dad Mamassa is providing pretty useless, so older brother Beaker steps in to help with the babysitting. Andean spectacled bear Bernie is determined to woo Lima when she enters her short window of fertility, and young male tortoise Football muscles in on 71-year-old Bert's harem of females.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: Are You Right There, Father Ted?.
programme.desc: The priest offends Craggy Island's Chinese community and pulls out all the stops to convince them that he is not racist - but his efforts end in disaster. Sitcom, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon, Frank Kelly and Pauline McLynn, with Ozzie Yue.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: World Para Athletics Championships London 2017: Day Three.
programme.desc: Arthur Williams, Sophie Morgan and Lee McKenzie present concluding coverage of the evening session on day three of the Championships, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Among the finals scheduled to take place tonight are the women's T42 100m and T35 200m, as well as the men's T13 and T44 100m, the T54 1500m, and the F35 shot put. With expert analysis from Stef Reid, Danny Crates, David Weir, and Liam Malone.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sarah, 35, arrives at King's College Hospital concerned that a brain tumour she first had as a teenager has returned. Helen, 47, is worried about her baby son James, who was born with a hole in his heart and one kidney, and has been vomiting since the morning, while 28-year-old Wayne seeks treatment for knife wounds to his leg after he tried to stop someone stealing his girlfriend's phone.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

It seems the victim had a stormy relationship with his brother and fellow band member Jim, while there are rifts between the others and more than one has an axe to grind. But how could any of them have done the deed when they were all in the studio at the time? programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Sunderland.
programme.desc: Ever since suffering a brain infection four years ago, Sunderland woman June Findlay has been unable to walk or talk and is totally dependent on her devoted husband John. Since then she has been sleeping on a hospital bed in the kitchen, with no washing or toilet facilities. Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays' home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. Can they give June back her dignity?.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Bury.
programme.desc: Two years ago, Michelle and Rod Malone set about adapting their home after daughter Maddie contracted a rare brain disease that left her struggling to walk and talk. However, unforeseen problems with the project left them living in just a couple of rooms in an unsafe house. Enter Nick Knowles and the DIY SOS builders, bolstered by an army of local tradespeople, to complete what the Malones started and give it a few finishing touches, courtesy of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen.(n)

programme.title: The Flash

Superhero adventure, starring Grant Gustin, Iris West, Carlos Valdes, Rick Cosnett and Tom Cavanagh.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: At Northumberland's Chillingham Castle, Sir Humphrey Wakefield prepares to hand over the estate to his apprehensive son Maximilian. Hard-working staff at Carlton Towers in North Yorkshire get ready for the arrival of 120 caravan owners for the annual rally and dinner dance.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In the final programme, he discovers how earthquakes wreak so much havoc.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Life in the Devon fishing port of Brixham. Spring is in the air, and the town is a hive of activity as skippers return their pleasure yachts to the water after winter in the dry dock, while the pressure is on for Brixham to look its best for the arrival of Princess Anne, who will officially open the new £20million fish market, and the start of the summer season.(n)

programme.title: Dinosaur 13
programme.desc: In 1990, paleontologist Peter Larson and his team from the Black Hills Institute made one of history's greatest dinosaur discoveries; the largest and most complete Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil ever found. The documentary details the true story behind the discovery, as well as the struggle that surrounded it, including a 10-year battle with the US government, museums, Native American tribes and competing paleontologists.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The grumpy medic is convinced a man with serious lung damage and a skin rash has been poisoned by heavy metals. He wonders whether the patient's wife is involved - though the team contend that the tests disprove the diagnosis. Meanwhile, House tires of having Wilson stay with him. Hugh Laurie and Robert Sean Leonard star.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The doctors struggle to find out why a girl suffers an allergic reaction in a sterile room after a heart transplant, until her boyfriend admits sneaking in for a late-night visit. After questioning him closely, House believes medication being taken by her partner could be the cause, but soon realises her problem is far more complicated. Michelle Trachtenberg guest stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A boy's symptoms remind House of a previous patient, who died before her condition could be diagnosed. Hugh Laurie plays the grumpy medic.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for a woman who disappeared mysteriously from her fiance's dinner party, while Samantha sees a therapist to help her deal with problems at work.(n)

programme.desc: A 14-year-old musical prodigy disappears on the night of a concert, taking her valuable violin with her. Meanwhile, Samantha tries to recover from her gunshot wound, but makes slow progress. Anthony LaPaglia stars.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team search for a missing woman whose description is similar to that of several murder victims from a 12-year-old case. Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery star.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for a missing teenage boy and it transpires that the youth had a faltering relationship with his girlfriend - could this hold the key to his whereabouts? Drama series, starring Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.desc: When a Hispanic boy is abducted from a Spanish Harlem street, Jack and the team are perplexed as to why family members have not come forward to help look for him. Drama, starring Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.desc: Tyrion's agenda in Slaver's Bay sees him seeking a new, strange ally. In the North, Brienne goes on a mission, while in Braavos, Arya is given a chance to prove herself. Fantasy drama, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, John Bradley, Hannah Murray and Maisie Williams.(n)

programme.title: Riviera
programme.desc: A frustrated Georgina uses the Clios Foundation's lavish gala as an opportunity to pin down a person of interest, but the party receives an uninvited guest.(n)

programme.desc: Frank searches Jackie's house for drugs. Meanwhile, the nurse connects with a homeless, alcohlic nun at work who seems to have given up on life. Dark comedy, starring Edie Falco and Merritt Wever.(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie
programme.desc: Zoey suspects something is wrong during her date with Prentiss, while Jackie's fake identity is compromised. Dark comedy, starring Edie Falco.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of London's most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell).(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A diary is discovered on a recycled computer, prompting Rush to reopen investigations into a woman's death. The victim had briefly enjoyed success as an internet millionaire before dying in 1999, seemingly of a stress-induced heart attack. Her main programmer is suspected of being somehow involved, but he has an airtight alibi. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A pair of PoW tags are discovered in an abandoned drug den, leading Rush and the team to re-examine the 1972 shooting of a Vietnam veteran. They discover his wife had been having an affair while he was fighting in the conflict, and her lover becomes their prime suspect - but more sinister motives soon rise to the surface. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The remains of a four-year-old girl are found at the bottom of the river, where they have apparently lain since 1965. programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The team reopens the 2001 case of a deli owner who was robbed and killed, leaving the neighbourhood shocked. programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush receives a tip-off about the killing of a man from the 1980s, and suspects the murder is linked to the four high-school friends with whom he lost touch eight years after graduation. programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Documentary series taking viewers inside the UK Border Agency, revealing the work that takes place behind the scenes of the immigration process. Teams at Heathrow Terminal 3, Calais, Dover and across the North West and North East of England reveal the methods and technology used to allow legitimate visitors safe passage while catching those who try to gain illegal entry to the UK.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Officers in Calais search lorries for illegal immigrants, while at Heathrow's Terminal Three a student is prevented from entering the UK after a trip to India.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Officers at Heathrow's Terminal 3 question a passenger from Johannesburg arriving in London on a tourist visa, suspecting he may be planning to work in the country. programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Immigration officers at Heathrow's Terminal 3 investigate a Jamaican man they believe to be a drug mule, following an X-ray that revealed suspicious objects inside his stomach.
